Reviews.Title: “Not returning”
Reviews.Author: Amen5
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed in this property for the Realtor convention. The first time it was brand new so I guess it was under utilized. Our room was a beautiful, first floor patio room right on the beach! Year two, we were not able to walk out on the beach level but at least there was a small balcony on which to enjoy the ocean view. By year three, now a Gold level Marriott rewards member, I was shown to a room with a wonderful view of the parking lot! When I questioned the front desk, the not too bright clerk told me this was the room I had requested. As if anyone requests a parking lot view! I asked for the Manager and was told he wasn't there. It never occurred to the young man to offer a Supervisor instead. Not that speaking to the supervisor had any effect either. The hotel was booked solid, there was no accomodation offered (so much for one class upgrade!), just so sad, too bad. It wasn't until much further in the conversation that I was told that the room I booked back in April was part of a block given to the convention and all they offered them was parking lot views! This was a major disappointment since there are beachfront hotels with gorgeous outdoor pools up and down the Boardwalk which include breakfast (Courtyard doesn't), have better parking and decent coffee (the coffee in the room is awful and paper cups? Really?) there just doesn't seem to be a reason to be loyal to Marriott in OC. Marriott wasn't showing any loyalty to me or the slightest concern for my happiness either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KJantz
Reviews.Content: After a last minute change in plans we successfully secured a room at the Couryard within 2 hours of our arrival in OC. What a pleasant surprise. The location was wonderful and the room was perfect. A wonderful hotel and staff. We will be going back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and wonderful view...”
Reviews.Author: Boricua78
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - only 3 years old. I stayed in a corner ocean front room which had a great wrap around balcony and wonderful view of the beach. There was a spacious kitchen like area with counter, fridge and microwave. Bathroom was nice sized but room was a tad small. The hotel service was very friendly and rooms and hotel as a whole were very clean - a bit rare for Ocean City as many of the hotels are quite old. The room was a bit expensive but to be expected during this time of year and with a convention going on. Food at the Captain's table was quite good, however, the service was super slow. Wait staff was friendly and trying to stay on top of things but the kitchen was behind... All in all a very nice stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...love the kids splash area”
Reviews.Author: businessmommie
Reviews.Content: Location for this property is stellar...and so far we have enjoyed our stay. I liked the pool area because it was small enough to keep the family all centrally located. There was also a neat little splash area for the toddlers. The staff were friendly,helpful and welcoming. I think there is something wonderful about Ocean City for families....and this hotel is just fine for all.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard by Marriott Ocean City great!!”
Reviews.Author: MatthewNJ
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in from the front desk staff to the Housekeeping staff, everyone was outstanding. Even the Restaurant had outstanding food and service. Now for the negative which is not much.... The price of room and food was $$$$$ very expensive. And the indoor pool is very small, the water looked green and mucky even thought they clean it everyday. There are always at least 20 kids in a pool with allot of splashing and noise, and what looks like a hot tub in pictures is just a small round tub, NOT a hot tub. I really wish they had a decent indoor pool. But hey you can't have everything. Other than that the hotel was perfect!!! And the free coffee everyday in lobby was a plus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Short stay but beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennyrose0853
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. Checked in at ten pm passing through. The rooms are so clean and nicely decorated. The balcony was a plus and the bed extremely confortable. Typical marriot with great upkeep. Breakfast was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay.”
Reviews.Author: kkcarter1
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that this is an okay stay and is not worth the price they are asking. Pros: 1. it is on the beach 15th street and is right off of the boardwalk. 2. it is updated and pretty clean. 3. we had a city view room and our room had a small view of the ocean. Cons: 1. parking is horrible, the parking under the hotel is small, a tight fit and most of the times there are no spaces available, you have to park across the street. 2. There is no lotion in the rooms (it seems like a small issue, but you are in the ocean or the pool and lotion is needed when your skinned is dried out). 3. It was extremely difficult to reserve the type of room you want because the hotel was packed to capacity- the only room I could get was a city view 2 queen for just my husband and myself (waste of space for just the 2 of us). 4. the pool is EXTREMELY small and the "hot tub" is just an extension of the pool and was not hot at all. 5. they give no incentives for marriott rewards members, you are like everyone else. 6. There is no room service after 10:30 (that can be a problem when you come to the hotel late and there are no options available to get a hot meal at the hotel- we actually had to order take out delivery :-( 7.no breakfast included (unlike the other hotels), the captains table- the food was average 8. the price, be prepared to pay a lot to stay here. I expected more from this hotel, especially if they are asking $399+ tax per night. They also require a deposit worth a full night and there is no cancellations 3 nights before checkin. We were experiencing a lot of bad weather in our city and we had to go through the weather to get to ocean city because we would lose $399+tax if we didn't check in. All in all, this hotel and stay was average at best, nothing special, just average. Honestly, I would only stay here again when the price is lowered. I feel like you can get something similar such as, the new Hampton, the Monte Carlo etc that is cheaper, has breakfast included and other incentives for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jaimeanne
Reviews.Content: This is the second year my family has selected this hotel, and once again it was a great choice. This hotel is very clean and has everything you need. The location is great, on the boardwalk 15th street, close enough, but far enough away from the noise. The pool is small, but very nice to have. The place is well worth the money. We have a great time, and love the property. We will be back next year for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott can't afford cable?”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie G
Reviews.Content: We splurged to stay at here during peak season. The location is great, right on the boardwalk with the ocean at your back door. The room was large and clean, the staff friendly. My only complaint was the TV - yes, I know, you're at the beach why are you watching TV? We like to keep up with local news, and at night after a full day at the beach it would have been nice to relax and watch a good movie or TV show. Apparently Marriott can't afford many channels, and none of them were local. The listing provided on a card in the room showed HBO and the usual suspects: USA, TNT, etc. Sorry, folks, don't really have those. We couldn't even watch a local baseball game. They apparently only had the basic Dish Network package, nothing for kids or adults except talking heads. And the local news? It was from New Jersey! This is a Maryland hotel. Very disappointing. When we went down to the hotel bar to try and catch that Washington Nationals baseball game the bartender said, "Sorry, we have the same TV service here that you do in your room. You should hear the complaints during football season!" Come on, Marriott, give a litle. Otherwise this was a great stay, but we won't be back here again.

Reviews.Title: “first class stay”
Reviews.Author: robin230
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the week and my only regret was the hotel was sold out for the weekend therefore we were unable to continue our fun! The experience was one Marriott company should be proud of. Top notch from the helpful bellman, the friendly front desk, warm cookies at check-in and the beds were so comfortable with soft sheets we wished we could bring them home! I saw complaints bout the pool which was small but clean and the "conversation" pit in the pool is just that! A added bonus sitting area in the pool. It Is not a hot tub nor does it say it is, We thouroughly enjoyed it. Whatever you do please enjoy the on site restuarant-The captains table. The food was outstanding and reasonably priced. They have a waiter there name Phillip who made us feels like kings & queens! We tried other places to save money only to realize the food at the marriott was much better and competivly priced. This was a first-class place and we especially loved the blue see-thru balconies to enjoy the evening sites!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip with the family.”
Reviews.Author: Dave D
Reviews.Content: Clean, clean, clean. Everything at this hotel was in great shape, clean linens, AC in room was great and adjustable. TIP: If staying with young kids they do have baby shampoo at the front desk. So convenient to be across the boardwalk from the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: luvanimals00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and I will never stay here again. The indoor pool was dirty and the "hot tub" wasent a hot tub at all. It was a conversation area?? I dont mind paying extra money to stay in a nice hotel but this was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The elevators also didnt work properly during my stay and my mother is disabled so the stairs werent really an option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Sally B
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at this hotel. Our family rented three rooms at this hotel and they all were great! Our stay was over July 4th and we were able to see the fireworks from our balcony! The Courtyard by Marriott is in a great location on the boardwalk at 15th street and is very beach accessible as well as close to many good restaurants and activities. We parked the car at the beginning of our stay and didn't move it the entire time we were there. The hotel and room were very modern and clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bartender made excellent drinks and was very informative. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It!!”
Reviews.Author: L S
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to OC, MD. I was a bit apprehensive about renting property versus staying in a hotel, my experience at the Courtyard OC made me very happy that I elected to stay at the hotel. The staff was really nice and attentive (I told myself to right down names, I remember Scott, Stacy, and Tasha; there was a really tall guy as well, I can't remember his name). I love being right on the boardwalk, as well as walking distance to great restaurants like Phillips and Fishtails. In addition to easy access to both activities in the ocean and the bay. Our room and linen were clean. MOST IMPORTANT...we had a great view partial ocean and city view (it doesn't sound good, but it was great) we had full view of the ocean on our left, and to our right Baltimore Ave. I was nervous about sound, but that was not a problem. My one complaint..the pool, it looks like a kiddie pool or large jacuzzi, the issue, there's a jacuzzi next to the pool that looks like it was made for hobbits...the hotel next door has this great outdoor pool (I guess if your tired of the salt water, we were a lil bit envious).

Reviews.Title: “More expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Lee C
Reviews.Content: As most of the hotels in Ocean City Md leave quite a bit to be desired it is nice to have Marriott level amenities right on the boardwalk/beach. It is a great location and unlike most hotels around here, it is CLEAN. Some minor lack of attention to detail keeps this from a 5 star review. (1) The hotel room was on the hot side, it appears you cannot control the temp and they set it at 74-75 degrees, which for me is too warm. (2) Housekeeping left us two conditioners instead of a shampoo and conditioner, which sounds minor until you are in the shower and realize you have no shampoo. For a hotel it is important to get those details right.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: JDHLAGRK
Reviews.Content: To find a combination of a nice, modern hotel - with a great location right on the beach - is not easy, nor will it be particularly cheap. However, I think this hotel is worth the cost, especially if you have kids. Being able to take the elevator from the 4th floor, and be on the beach, in less than 2 minutes is pretty nice. We found the hotel to be very clean and well kept up (I believe it is relatively new). Rooms were nice sized, and have 2 queen beds, a fridge, and a microwave, which is nice when travelling with kids. Balconies were an added perk, but beware not all of them look out on the ocean (although most do in some fashion). There is a small pool here that is a nice escape for the kids during the blaring afternoon sun - but don't be fooled by the pictures, there is no hot tub, just a "conversation pit". I found the staff at the hotel to be a bit on the disinterested side...not unfriendly, but not particularly warm or engaging. For example, we got there about 2:00 on our arrival day...when I went to check in, I was told "your room is not ready...probably around 4:00". So my family and I just sat in the lobby and played cards...at 3:00 my wife went back up to the desk after we saw 3 or 4 other families check in...at which point we were told, yes, your room has been ready for 1/2 hour or so...unclear to me why we couldn't have been told this since we were sitting all of 20 feet away! Parking is a bit adventuresome here, as it is everywhere in Ocean City. If you are lucky, you can squeeze into a small spot in the "parking garage" under the hotel...but it is more likely you'll wind up in a dedicated lot across the street. The Captain's Table restaurant serves good food, but doesn't have much in the way of "ambiance", and their dinner prices are aggressively high. They have an early bird menu from 4-6, but you have to ask for it...they won't volunteer it. Overall, we were pleased with our stay and would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Accomadations,location ,breakfast was good and the ocean view was awesome !”
Reviews.Author: Naejoy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in room 220 with Ocean view. The only complaint that I have is the annoying smell in the room . . As soon as we walked in the room we can smell a bad scent around the Foyer area especially around the Fridge and microwave. We called the desk to let them know ,they sent the cleaning people right away but all they did was spray febreeze cleanser around the area which really didn't help, after the second call to the front desk they offered to send someone first thing the next morning I had already planned to check out in the next 24 hrs. so we lived with the smell. My family was very disappointed that we couldn't change our room because all of the rooms were already booked .I can't imagine a nice hotel like this one allowing the room to have an unpleasant sent and not do anything so they may have already fixed the problem. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay; Great Location; Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ATrav-El-Holic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of spring as my husband attended a fishing trip. The location is right on the beach with very easy beach access. It is about center the boardwalk area so there are several restaurants, eateries and shops within steps of the hotel. The walk down to Jolly Rogers and the arcade is pretty long, but a $3 tram ride helped with that. We opted for an oceanfront room for a small upgrade charge, which offered an amazing view of the boardwalk and ocean, as well as a balcony for lounging (large enough for two comfortably). We appreciated the fact that this hotel is non-smoking, both in the rooms and on the balconies. The room itself (double beds) was spacious with updated furniture and linens...a definite upgrade from some of the old outdated motels Ocean City has. The bathroom was a nice size and very clean. The room also had a mini-fridge. Beds were pretty comfy. The restaurant at the hotel (Captain's table) has a great breakfast menu. We ate there twice during our stay for breakfast and had a great meal on both occasions. As far as price, it probably is a little pricey (most items are sold as ala carte), but I feel like we got our money's worth and we definitely enjoyed it. The property has a garage with free parking for guests...although it doesn't hold nearly enough spaces for the number of rooms that the hotel has and the spaces are really narrow. BUT, the hotel has remedied that issue by offering more than enough spaces right across the street, which is just a few steps. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. We had a great time and our 5-yr old daughter keeps asking to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Front, Nicely Away from the Downtown Bustle”
Reviews.Author: EFE2000
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean. Right on the boardwalk, but far enough away from the downtown t-shirt and arcade storefronts. Good restaurants nearby (enjoyed Brother's Pizza). Parking was easy and never full, even on the weekend. A little pricey, but I think the cleanliness more than made up for it from what I've heard about other hotels in OC. Had lunch at the Captain's Table restaurant in the hotel - great food and good service. Overall, very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at OCMD 20-23 June 2012”
Reviews.Author: LifeisGood6869
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay in OCMD hands down. Stayed in the ground level w/ a HUGE patio. The rooms were very nice as well as the staff. The Captains Table is a nice restaurant and has an extended breakfast time until 1:00pm. We didn't use the pool or spa (had really nice weather), however I was very impressed with how it was laid out. I can't stress enough how nice and relaxing it was to sit out on the patio and relax as people walk by. Being able to walk from the room to the beach in a matter of seconds was priceless, especially this being my 4yr old daughter's first trip to the beach. The location is perfect and very close to many things. As for places to eat, we ate at a few places that were decent and nice, however I was not impressed with Jonah and the Whale Seafood Buffet. Go to Embers. I'm sure the Captains Table would be great for dinner based off of their menu, we just never got around to eating dinner there. As for the cost of rooms: you get what you pay for. It may be a little pricy, but it is worth it, especially if you take part in their rewards program. I have stayed in some really nice hotels in Dubai and Ocean City Marriott will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kowalczyk86
Reviews.Content: Top-notch hotel in Ocean City We were oceanside so of course we had a great view. The room was very clean, we had help with our bags, and parking is in a free garage which is a plus. Overall we had a great time. The only reason I may not return to this hotel mid-summer is because of pricing. All of Ocean City gets very expensive July/August though - just have to find a cheaper hotel or suck it up! We stayed at the very beginning of June and paid $230/night.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: hanovertodisney
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've stayed at this hotel, and the second time I've written a review for it. I stayed two nights and was impressed again. Everything was clean, comfortable, and the staff was quick and friendly. The location is great and within walking distance to many of the attractions. The pool area was clean and the hotel had easy access the beach. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great beachfront location”
Reviews.Author: dar019
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the newly redone portion of the boardwalk. The location is great, rooms are a nice size with small oceanfront balconies. Don't expect privacy on these as sound carries here. The hotel is the site of the well known and good Captain's Table restaurant. Free use of lobby internet, helpful and friendly staff, clean, nice size, comfortable rooms. Free parking but no continental breakfast. I guess because the hotel's breakfast is so good. This is a great choice if you can afford it. We happened to go on off season at a conference price but not everyone is so lucky. If you can pay the nightly rate, try it, it really is a nice choice for an OC o/f hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Here, Still a Nice Choice in OC”
Reviews.Author: YoungBuckTravel
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel. We stayed here 3 years ago when it first opened and were pleasantly surprised at the hotel considering that the vast majority of the hotels in Ocean City are run down. Not much has changed with the hotel in that 3 years and it appears that the management has been keeping up with the property quite well. We had an ocean front room that overlooked the beach and boardwalk. It had a small but adequate balcony to enjoy the view from. The rooms were clean and the beds are still super comfortable. The staff are friendly and the location is nice since it's on the quiet end of the boardwalk. In terms of pricing, this hotel is going to run you a lot more money as compared to other hotels along the boardwalk. Even with our AAA discount, the hotel still was an average of $30-$50 more a night than some other hotels in the general vicinity. But again, you are getting a much nicer and much cleaner hotel than the cheaper ones. The pool area as mentioned is quite small and the parking garage is laid out quite awkwardly. I can see how large vehicles would have difficulty moving around. I would have no regrets recommending this hotel to any friends or family. In fact, I think even though it is more expensive it is probably one of the better options in Ocean City. The only hotels that may top this are the Holiday Inn Suites (17th St/Boardwalk) or the Hilton Oceanfront Suties (21st St). Holiday Inn would be more for families and the Hilton would be for those with a lot more extra money. We normally do not stay at a hotel twice unless we really like it so I think that maybe keeping that in mind shoudl help. Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “This hotel had so much promise.”
Reviews.Author: keytonsraven
Reviews.Content: We are in the hotel this weekend. When you get here, you have to park across the street. That is somewhat expected down here. When you get into the room, it is a very big room with a nice view. The problem is with the sound thin walls and doors. You can hear all of your neighbors, especially if they are on the decks til 3am. Also, you can not keep ur windows open because people are smoking on the balconies. You figure for a $300/night hotel, they would have people roaming around to make sure there policies that you sign for when you check in are kept up. If you are family, definetly do not stay here. The only perk is being on the boardwalk. If you want to be on the beach, stay at the princess. Never had a problem with noise and smoking there. Platinum Elite Member.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Courtyard's”
Reviews.Author: Tina S
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how big the room was. I booked a king with sofabed with city view. The sofa with a chair had it's own little area with a large flatscreen tv on the wall. The sleeping area had a king bed, another tv and chair, desk and a small counter with small fridge and micorwave underneath it. The bathroom had a deep whirlpool tub, plenty of counter space on vanity. There was also a separate vanity right outside the bathroom. The room was like a mini suite which was nice. The quality of the bed, sheets and shower is what you would expect from a Courtyard. It's not the best but what expected. The season hasn't kicked-off yet so it was very quiet at the hotel - not many people working. Check-in staff were ok - not very talkative but not unfriendly. The seafood at the restaurant were very fresh. Portions were huge so we were happy that there was a fridge and microwave in the room. The waiter (sorry, I'm so bad with names) was very friendly and attentive so at least he made us feel welcome. The hotel was pretty much what I would expect from a Courtyard - actually a little better because of the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “A gem on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: JA-GirlinNH
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right on the boardwalk but since it wasn't the "season" not too busy. The rooms are funky and very clean, the restaurant had amazing food (order the crab cakes broiled so you can taste the crab). Our server was wonderful. Although the room was great, the balcony on floor 2 overlooking an empty pool was not. Iasked about a higher up roomand they said they were all booked. We are gold members of Marriott and when we booked our room they said we were getting an upgrade, Marriott obviously does not know this hotel does not "upgrade" and all points members get the same room for 35k points. There are two chairs on the deck, and you can't fit anything else. We were just staying one night so it was okay but in summer, pay to be higher up.

Reviews.Title: “Not fond of Rewards stay”
Reviews.Author: julemag
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least six times and have always been able to use reward points for at least part of my stay. As a Gold member, all of the documentation that I receive from Marriott says not black out periods. Someone needs to remind the hotel of this policy. When I wanted to use points for two of the four nights I had reserved I was told that there were no more reward rooms available. What????? the reservation was booked months in advance and there are no black out dates. I was told that the hotel restricted the number of reward rooms because of the events for the weekend. When I pushed on no black out dates, they came back and said that I could use points, but would need to move in the middle of my stay because the reward room could not be an ocean facing room. What????? I continued to push the issue and Amber in Member Services was able to convince the hotel to allow me to use points for the first two nights and pay for the weekend nights (higher rate) and to have an ocean facing room for the entire stay. This was very disappointing as I have never had any push back using points at any Marriott property. It looks like I may start staying more at Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “TYPICAL BEACH TOWN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Gebhard18
Reviews.Content: Was a little disappointed about the rooms VIEW OF THE OCEAN. Most rooms are on the side and only SMALL VIEW OF THE OCEAN. The balcony is EXTREMELY SMALL only 2 chairs barely fit on. The indoor pool is like an OVERSIZED TUB!! Can't imagine being there in the summer when it is full!! . Overall the room was nice A TYPICAL MARRIOTT. Would definitely NOT STAY THERE DURING PEAK SUMMER TIME. For the money stay in one of the condos a full kitchen and nice size pool. OVERPRICED FOR WHAT YOU GET.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure the boardwalk repair is complete! This is not typical Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: TerrapinTravelers
Reviews.Content: We were not able to apply our AAA rating for the room as we were told that because we booked online we booked an upgraded room. There was not any mention of the booked room being an "upgrade". However, when we arrived, we were generously given a corner room, oceanfront upgrade. We were shocked when we opened the drapes to discover that there was no boardwalk frontage as it was totally under construction! It obstructed what otherwise would have been a lovely view from the second floor- a bit close to the mess. You had to walk a block in either direction to get to the boardwalk! We knew this was not the fault of the Marriott, as it was a city repair, but we were surprised that there was no mention of this on the website and we were still charged the same! This is an interesting property.....the layout to access the rooms is strange and there is no pay per view in the room or any DVD players. Complimentary coffee was available in the room and downstairs in the lobby in the morning. Internet was free in the room. Our breakfast in the conveniently located restaurant was satisfying and the pricing was reasonable. Service was good. Bar staff was terrific. Pool area seemed small and was crowded. The room could have been a bit cleaner-the wrapped glasses were really dirty. Cleaning staff were very polite and friendly. Ashley at the front desk was as helpful as possible, but her response to our concerns was practiced. When we finally spoke with the manager, Spencer, he gave us a $50 discount on the total price of our stay, which we appreciated, since we were awakened by the construction crew first thing Monday morning! Overall, I don't think we would stay at this property again since it is not far from an all oceanfront suites Holiday Inn on the boardwalk with more amenities for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “By the ocean and boardwalk, lovely facility, great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Dakota57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the beach and boardwalk (currently being rebuilt), a great location allowing you to walk to all of the boardwalk area. The site appears new (told it was a rebuilt from another facility), rooms are spacious and have a fridge and microwave which is handy. We asked locals for good places to eat, and they, not knowing where we were staying, gave us the name of the restaurant at the hotel. It is owned separately and has been a local favorite for years - we ate there one night and it was exceptional. Staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Get an oceanfront room on floor 3 or 4”
Reviews.Author: MeginOz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a basic Courtyard set-up, but the ocean views from the 3rd and 4th floors are lovely. The clear glass balconies make the rooms have a nicer view than those at the Hilton up the street. The boardwalk was under renovation when I visited, making a lot of noise in the early morning and some inconvenience for getting around. I wish that the front desk staff would have told us about that at check in, just to be aware. Rooms were clean and hotel staff was helpful. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hpm024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott in Ocean City for the Valentines day weekend. We were very impressed with the hotel decor. Very modern and clean. The rooms all have flat screens and we had a view of the ocean that was awesome. The front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating. I would return here in a heartbeat. They also have great rates in the off season as well. The captain table is an excellent pricey restaurant in the lobby which we had some drinks there. The pool fitness center and Jacuzzi were great too. I would recommend this place to anyone considering a trip to the beach who wants to be in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: cw413
Reviews.Content: I have been taking my family to Ocean City for years. We stayed at the Courtyard for a few days. Due to limited space, the hotel is very 'vertical'. It makes the most it can of the limited space. The pool is a big disappointment, though. If you have small children who enjoy swimming, this is not the place for you. If you use the Marriott Rewards program, it seems the points are never accepted for summer reservations at this location. I have stayed at many Marriott's, but this one missed the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: inthewind2010
Reviews.Content: This is a bright spot on the ocean city. The hotel is fairly new and has a contemporay vibe. The registration desk was helpful and friendly. The room was spacious and very clean. the bed was comfortable. The hotel is right on the boardwalk. As a single female staying in the hotel, I felt safe. the only thing I did not like is that the hotel is next door to a dump of a motel. So I kept the curtains closed. The other thing is parking maybe a problem during the busy summer months. They only allow one spot per room and there is limited covered parking under the hotel. I beleive there is a parking lot across the street that can be used as well. I would highly recommend this place if visiting Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Registration Advice”
Reviews.Author: karen v
Reviews.Content: My friend booked what she thought was an "oceanfront" higher floor room. When we arrived, it was indeed an oceanfront room but a specific category called "oceanfront - ground floor." She was not told about it being a ground floor. The room was directly on the boardwalk, poor view of the ocean, but would offer others on the boardwalk a great view of the room! Access to the "courtyard" seemed to be easy to achieve thus a major security issue. We did not stay. When you schedule a room at this hotel, be sure to ask many specific questions as the reservations clerks as well as the front desk staff have extrememly poor customer service skills. I was extremely dissapointed in this Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: delidar
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice, very clean, decor was nice - view was incredible. Only issue - for the price no continental breakfast, parking not an issue in January can't imagine summertime. they do have a parking area on the next block.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City Md Courtyard”
Reviews.Content: Clean and great for a short stay. Bathtub in handicapped room was too deep and very hard to get in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, and Attractive...Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: initfrfn
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a quick trip the beach and chose the Courtyard. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room. The carpet did have 3 orange stains and will probably be replaced before the busy season starts .With that being said, the room was very clean as it passed the sock test with flying colors. The glass barriers on the balcony allow a great view. Furnishings all looked new and I believe it's been 2 years since Marriott took over this property. Comfortable and quiet, even with occupied rooms on both sides. Tight parking and a bit of a walk to our room were certainly not deal breakers. Check in was a pleasant experience, got to love those cookies !

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place we have stayed in OC!”
Reviews.Author: mdgipsy
Reviews.Content: Right on 15th street and the boardwalk, parking garage with tight spaces. Quick checkin though why give 2 cookies when we were checking in with our son (makes 3 right?). Room very nice3, new, clean, quiet, great ocean front view with tiny little balcony big enough for 2 chairs. Nice pool area, tile floors very slippery though, surprised people haven't fallen, yikes! Ate breakfast in their restaurant which was fine if not a little pricey. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Sunforfungirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the winter, so a summer experience may be different. We were ocean front. The room was spacious and well laid out. The property appeared to be new. It was quiet and peaceful (even on new years eve). Every room has a balcony perfect for watching the waves. Plenty of free on site parking. We could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahl541
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The decor all throughout was very classy and the lobby and common areas were clean and well maintained. There is even a nice restaurant here on the 3rd floor. Our room was very comfortable and clean- it had a flat screen TV, a micro/fridge, great lighting, and a balcony. Even though our room wasn't oceanfront, we could still see the ocean because of the way the hotel is set up. We didn't get to explore the area much because Ocean City is almost entirely closed down for the winter but it seems to be in a good location, right on the boardwalk off of 15th street. The area felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business meetings!”
Reviews.Author: blueghost
Reviews.Content: I came here for a business meeting, and was impressed with everything across the board.

Reviews.Title: “Really”
Reviews.Author: robert G
Reviews.Content: I will be as straight as I can. This hotel has nice accomodations and a good restuarant, however the staff is substandard. When we arrived they had us sign some crazy waiver about our activities. This was not on the website they just hit you with this when you come. My response is "save that crap for the 20 year olds". There was no creamer or sugar in our room. When we went down to get some they had stashed in some cabinet with plenty, these guys plain and simply are all about collecting your money and not being good to the customer. Save your money and go some where else that knows how to treat thier guests We are leaving a day early because of our experience. BEFORE YOU STAY HERE CALL AND HAVE THEM FAX YOU THE WAIVER THAT THEY WILL REQUIRE YOU TO SIGN. Not on par with othere Marriots I have stayed with. The only reason I cant give this place a terrible rating is because they have a good restuarant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MikeGloucester_VA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business trip. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Coffee is lobby was superb, and never empty. Rooms were very clean. I left a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door one day, and cleaning lady left a bagful of supplies, towels, soap, shampoo, etc outside the door. Impressive! This is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Off Season Spot”
Reviews.Author: 1Paul
Reviews.Content: The hotel was warm and inviting. The restaurant had excellent food which was good because most of the town was in moth balls for the winter. We were given a beachfront room as an upgrade without even requesting.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Andjayne
Reviews.Content: clean , modern hotel and great for the price considering how good the location is . Loved the free wi-fi throughout the hotel

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING.....Bugs found in beds”
Reviews.Author: teresa r
Reviews.Content: We went up to Ocean City for the weekend. Had a great view of the ocean from our room & was looking forward to seeing it in the morning when the sun was up. It was about midnight on our first night and we were getting ready to go to bed when our son starts complaining of bugs. Upon further investigation, we checked and saw several little bugs and one larger bug, which totally freaked & disgusted me. We then checked the other bed and found one of the larger bugs in that bed as well. Immediately I then called the front desk, who was very apologetic and said he would come and take a look. He came up about 10 minutes later with his flashloght and took a look. He saw the bugs and offered us another room. Due to the fact that we were 3 hours from home, we almost considered it. The desk clerk said we could check out the room first and he would call us in a few minutes. We then looked at the bed more carefully and when we took the pillows off, we then found a PUBIC HAIR in the bed which pushed me over the edge. We checked out immediately and drove three hours and finally made it home by 4 in the morning and all took hot showers. There was no way after that to able to check into another hotel & rest and not worry about what is in the bed The hotel seemed pretty and the view from our room was great, but I definately would not recommend this hotel. Definately not what I expected of a Marriott hotel............HORRIBLE

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, thats about it...”
Reviews.Author: godzuki24
Reviews.Content: You take the good, you take the bad, you put them all together and have the facts of life. The location of the CYOC is FANTASTIC! On the beach (15th St) so you can walk to most anywhere fun on the boardwalk. The restaurant is slightly over priced, but its fine- food is decent. The hotel is made for business travel, but has a slight vacation feel to it. Parking is good if you can get one of the spots. Staff is friendly enough, but nothing special. Now here comes the bad. The pool stinks. It’s touted as an indoor/outdoor pool, but it’s an indoor with giant French doors which open to a inward facing sitting area and single sprinkler/waterpark. The pool leaves a LOT to be desired. Then there is the “Conversation Pit”. It used to be a hot tub, but is now a lukewarm bowl. Seriously??? Yes, it appears that the owners didn’t want to pay the utilities to heat and operate the hot tub, so they turned off the heat and jets and made the “Conversation Pit”. It’s a hot tub which isn’t hot and doesn’t have working jets. So, its completely useless. Its almost offensive. The exercise room is decent with nice equipment, but is lacking in variety- though the space is great. The AC units in the rooms are very difficult to operate by design. I get that the hotel doesn’t want you to crank the AC and then leave the balcony door open, but they need to make them easier to use, or leave proper directions. I enjoyed my stay, but was not blown away. If you think about Location, Location, Location, this place can’t be beat. If you think about family, function, and fun, you might be better off somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “boys golf weekend away - suite 505”
Reviews.Author: PapaKMichigan
Reviews.Content: boys golf getaway weekend 9/30-10/2. this suite ROCKED!!!! great ocean front views....and bathroom in each bedroom, important when the boys are drinking into the night. full kitchen for cooking all the food u need. and a cat nap on the porch is awesome. close to food, boardwalk right outside....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Leehiway
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no complaints from check-in through check-out. Spent four nights at this nice facility without a hitch. Great location right on the Boardwalk at 15th Street. Free parking in garage underneath - but those spaces are tight with lots of support posts to bang your doors on, so you may wish to opt for the overflow parking lot right across Baltimore Street (we did after the first night). Friendly staff, and the room was kept neat and clean daily - no mean feat considering the sand and beach dreck that go with oceanside fun and kids. We did not avail ourselves of the rather pricey Captains Table Restaurant onsite. We're not cheapskates, but there are plenty of other restaurants in this town where you can get good meals at more reasonable prices. Nice indoor pool area should bad weather hit. We definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “City View Room”
Reviews.Author: fusion2011
Reviews.Content: Our first two nights in a city view room were interrupted by a carpet cleaning truck operating under our window. It roared like a jet plane from 10:00 P.M. to 11:30 P.M.. Not conducive to a good nights rest. The rest of our stay it was just a noisey location. Room was clean and large. Hotel staff was courteous and helpful. I would not recommend a City View if it is a quiet vacation you desire.

Reviews.Title: “WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE eggs benedict”
Reviews.Author: memehazel
Reviews.Content: We had a very good breakfast there. I like eggs benidict and had reviewed many hotels for restaurants. I found the Captains Galley and low and behold eggs benedict. I also like lox and bagels, they were there also. My husband liked his omelet. We decided we will go back to the captains galley again later this month (Sept 2011) for another breakfast. We were seated at windows that overlooked the side street but you can also be served poolside. We did not want to move our car from our hotel parking lot as we were there over labor day week-end so we were looking for places to eat locally. A little pricy but we have paid these prices for years when we would go into New York City. I would not call this a cheap of dirty hotel. We did not encounter any cigarette smoke, but if the smoke was in an open air area how can anyone complain. YES I would give this restaurant a 4 star rating and recommend it for good food (forgive my spelling of eggs benedict)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay!”
Reviews.Author: Libearty
Reviews.Content: I have always tried to stay at a Marriott if possible, in the past they have been nice. This hotel allows smokingbin the courtyard and on balconies, contrary to their signs by every entrance and at the front desk. I was personally told by the front desk, when I called to complain, that smoking was permitted in the courtyard, however it's funny there are no ashtrays anywhere!?! I had to sign a form checking in about smoking and the fine. My husband and I heard renters on the balcony rooms tell other balcony users they had stayed there other times and the "management" are " really good" about smoking rules! I pay extra to stay at smoke free facilities for myself and my family, this is clearly FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! Groups of men congregated on their balconies yelling back and forth to each other, drinking, yelling obscene remarks to boardwalkers and making fun of people, using bulling language, two balconies above my room, I was on the ground floor, men were spitting into the courtyard. I complained to the front desk twice, nothing was stopped. My husband actually had to say something to the people himself and almost got into a fight with them. I suggest no one stay at this facility EVER! This certainly is not a family oriented facility!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel and the restaurant, would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: zebra1213
Reviews.Content: The room had an awesome view of the ocean and we found it to be clean and spacious. We ate breakfast and dinner at the hotel restaurant which was very good. The location is good but having never been to Ocean City, MD before I found the trams to be costly and annoying (not a ding on the hotel though). Parking is tight and we were hesitant to move the car.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations of Ocean City hotels”
Reviews.Author: dewhee32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a spontaneous trip to Ocean City for the latter part of Labor Day weekend (Sun-Tues). Having been to OC many, many times, I was expecting a typically, boardwalk hotel perhaps on the dingy and dark side. I usually always consult TripAdvisor before booking a hotel anywhere, but this was not a normally well- planned trip, so I just went with the flow. Not knowing what to expect, I was highly surprised when I saw the Courtyard Marriott. The balconies of the hotel were great, and I was eager to check out the property. The lobby was fantastic and I felt like we were actually in a "resort" property. Check in was a breeze. The rooms were modern and new. The beds were extremely comfortable and the mini-fridge and microwave were a nice touch. Flat screen TVs were nice as well. My only complaints are mostly minor. A mini bar of soap is not sufficient for a family of 4 taking about 2 baths/showers per day. At the beach, even one wash cloth isn't enough per day, so I would bring additional shower wash or soap for your use, and snag extra wash cloths if you can. The indoor pool is nice, although the water around it tends to build up. I saw one man almost fall from slipping. It would help if someone came around to brush the water away from the walkways around the pool. The hotel restaurant was nice, although service seemed slow and food average. For breakfast, it was perfectly convenient. Overall, I have no problems recommending this property for your stay in Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “Best place I have stayed so far.”
Reviews.Author: Hockeygrrl75
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to finally find a hotel in OC that was clean! The bathroom was immaculate and there was no trace of sand or beach in the hotel. The one thing that was disappointing was how slow the elevators are. Luckily I was on the 2nd floor so I was able to use a exit door to get outside. And the hotel needs to label the elevators better to let guests say that the front desk in on the 3rd floor. I tried to use their business center and I think they are still on dial-up cause it was really slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wheelingalong
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott, although expensive, was a very clean, functional hotel in a great location. Our party consisted of teenagers and "pre-teens, who all loved the boardwalk area and amusements. The beach was great, and nice to have both pool and ocean within steps of each other. The only negative with this hotel is their policy regarding no rollaway beds. For a 'family' hotel, in a vacation setting, and with the size of the rooms being very adequate, I think they should rethink their policy. Many other Marriotts I have stayed in with three kids, and smaller rooms, have allowed rollaways. But, all in all, it was a great stay - would definately return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean property right on the boardwalk and the beach”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelinfamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overall in good shape maybe more like a 3 star property but I gave it four stars because the location is right on the beach and boardwalk. The pool area is nicely maintained but the pool is indoors with outside seating. Expensive for this type of property during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: nomad018
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott Ocean City was fabulous! We stayed one night and had an oceanfront room. We stepped out on the balcony and it took us several minutes before we could pull ourselves away from the expansive breathtaking view of the ocean and make our way down to the boardwalk. The boardwalk is very clean and there is just one large tram that ferries folks along the way. There are all the standard beach shops along the boardwalk and plenty of eateries. The room was very clean and inviting, with free internet access, flat screen tv, microwave and a small fridge. The bedding was very soft and plush, topnotch. The bathroom was very clean, with marble counters and plenty of towels for the two of us. The hotel staff was very friendly and courteous. We had breakfast at the Captain' s table and the food was very good. The hotel is very pricey at this time of year, which I guess is expected, but we had a very nice time and will likely be back during the offseason.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Chatterboxbk987
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott from August 1st through August 5th and I wish we could have stayed longer. I will start out by saying that we booked this hotel through Priceline and got a great deal. If not for Priceline this hotel would be waaaaayyyy out of my budget. It may be worth every penny, but I do not believe that ANY hotel should be this pricey for just a room which you do not even get 24 hours in. I was pleasantly surprised by the elegance the hotel had since it was a beachfront hotel in Ocean City. Usually the hotels at most shore Towns are a bit run down due to the elements, but the Marriott was clean and fresh looking. The rooms were stylish, roomy, clean and comfy. If I had any complaints at all, it would be that the lighting in the bathroom was very dim. I would suggest upgrading the wattage on the lightbulbs used. Also, the pool was a bit small. However, the hotel is located on the boardwalk and beachfront so I guess the pool size does not matter, but for those that do not like to go into the ocean water the pool is a great option. The pool area itself is beautiful and I love the sun beds and lounge chairs. Very spa-like, but not pretentious. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrst37
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel with a great location. We had an ocean view room, which was exactly that! We arrived early & were permitted to check in. Directly on the beach & boardwalk. Rooms were clean. The pool was very small, the hot tub was small & not very "hot". If I could say anything negative, I would suggest that they add a complimentary breakfast, for the rates they charge. There is a small microwave & mini fridge in the room. Overall, nice vacation, and definitely would stay again but not during the peak season when the rates are extremely high!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel But not Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dewitttraveler7
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 boys (ages 10 & 13) stayed for 5 nights. The pluses: Clean hotel, Friendly and responsive staff, great location on the boardwalk, pool is small but our boys loved it. The room has a small refrigerator and microwave. The downside is it's a Courtyard that's designed for business travelers. It doesn't have the amenities families use when they're on a vacation for an extended time. The lobby and pool are on the 3 rd floor and there is no view of the ocean. When you are in the hotel, there is no way of knowing you're on the ocean. You could be in a hotel in Chicago . The building has a strange design and has multiple stairways and elevators. None seem practical. You can't just walk out the door and go to the beach. Coffee in the lobby is only out for certain hours (morning and early evening), the Market place has a few items but nothing practical. The room has a huge computer table but no table to sit at and have a quick breakfast. The only room service available is ordering from the Captains Table restaurant. They do not have copies of the menu and don't allow you to take menus to the room but you are welcome to view the menu in the lobby. Sounds trivial but it's not a room or building designed for a relaxing vacation. It's for business travelers. The only way I'd stay here again is if we got a great deal or used our Marriott points. We would we pay the regular room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not your monies worth...”
Reviews.Author: darlingncola
Reviews.Content: The pool is very very small.....and was very crowded with kids all the time. There is what appears to be a hot tub off on the side, but it is really what they call a"conversation pit"...a waste of space. The gym is almost non existing. The location on the beach is good. Although the underground parking is very minimal...there is additional parking across the street. The rooms are very nice but not all have balconies. I will say that I was very dissapointed in this hotel. With the name Marriott I expected a little more.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great here and will book next year for sure!”
Reviews.Author: jaimeanne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! We took a family vaction there for a week and this location was everything we wanted and more. The hotel was VERY CLEAN and the service was wonderful. The location was also perfect. We were able to leave the hotel and walk right down the boardwalk to all the action. I would really recommend this Court Yard to and one who is going on a trip to Ocean City any time soon. I know for certain we will book again for next year! You won't be disappointed with the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute best hotel in O.C Maryland”
Reviews.Author: Corlii
Reviews.Content: The first year my family stayed in this hotel we were blown away by it's cleanliness. The people at the front desk were eager to help us get to our room quickly after a tiring four hour drive. Our family of five conveniently fit in the room that we had reserved since we have two small children and a 10 year old. The location next to the board walk and the beach was very convenient. The pool area was perfect for our kids since it was never really crowded. We were able to get information about nearby restraunts from the front desk. And every morning coffee was placed conveniently in the front lobby. The restraunt in the hotel is absolutely delicious and the balcony in the rooms made it easy to dry our towels. We have came back and stayed at this hotel every year since it opened. And we are always so excited to come. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, would not return”
Reviews.Author: catfire0
Reviews.Content: This was the most sub-par Marriott I have ever stayed in. Being a platinum elite member of the Marriott rewards program, I have stayed in my fair share of Marriott hotels and this is by far the worst. I expected more from a Marriott then the room being smaller than a holiday inn, the drain in the shower not working (had to prop it open with a shampoo bottle) the vending machines were "out of order", there was no milk or cream (non flavored) for the coffee station, but you could go to the restaurant and buy coffee to get some creamer. There was no hospitality suite, no roll away beds, and no sofa beds in the queen rooms. the outdoor pool was in the middle of the hotel and not really outdoor, the sliding glass doors opened so there was air that flowed through....Horrible hotel, I would recommend staying anywhere else in Ocean City before I stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CJC_11_11
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is an all around must-stay for vacationers! Friendly staff. Service is excellent! Rooms are very clean, and nicely decorated. On site, "Captain's Table Restaurant", has delicious food, and great service. This Hotel made our wonderful family vacation together, even more wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Take Two . . . Still wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: HonestLadyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used priceline to get a good deal for Ocean City from July 2 - 9th. We just got back and I had to write my review!!! We got an amazing deal on this hotel, and I can not say enough about how amazing it is!!!! We stayed here once before, and our second trip was just as awesome as our first. The room was large, sunny, and clean!!! I did all of the checks for bed bugs and there were NONE to be found! Everything was spotless when we arrived in our room. The hotel smelled nice and clean. We did not have a direct oceanview - but we did not book an oceanview room - so this was expected. We had a nice balcony that overlooked a sidestreet, and we could see the boardwalk. We used the fitness center everyday, and it was never crowded. The service when we arrived to the moment we left was fantastic! The front desk staff was very nice, and helpful. Our room was serviced everyday, and we were not disturbed when we had our do not disturb sign up. Parking and internet were free, which is an added bonus! The ONLY things that could be improved - 1. The pool :( This leaves MUCH to be desired. I wish they would have an outdoor pool, or one that was a tad bit bigger. The hotel next door has a HUGE pool and watching those guests enjoy the large outdoor pool was painful because the one in this hotel is pretty bad - unless you are a little kid. 2. The Pillows! They were not very comfy! Next time, I will be bringing my own. Overall you can not beat the location for the price we got!! We had a great trip and already miss the Courtyard Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel3313
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms and the front desk really makes you feel at home . The oceanfront rooms are really nice it is awesome to have a view of the ocean from the room. The only problem I had was in the restaurant the server was unattentive and I was disappointed in her attitude. She seemed like she didn't really want to be there. But the food was great and the front desk staff made up for our problem with the waitress with really excellent customer service. I know another person said the reservations assured them there would be a cot available to put in the room. I know when I get patched through to the general reservations for all the hotels they do not know everything about the particular hotel I want to stay in but they think they do. I have found it is always better to make sure you call the hotel directly that you are trying to gather information on and make sure they and not the general reservations are giving you the information. Great hotel will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in accomodations”
Reviews.Author: craftercol
Reviews.Content: When making our reservation for 5 to stay at the Marriott we were assured that the room could accomodate a 5th person with a cot. Upon arriving, we were told that no cots (or anything similar) were available. I asked what we should do and the response from the hotel clerk was that she was very sorry and would advise the manager to speak to the reservation desk. I am not one to rant and rave or carry on but perhaps I should have. My daughter had to SLEEP IN A CHAIR FOR 5 DAYS. Nothing but an "I'm sorry" was offered. Well Marriott, I am sorry we will no longer stay at your hotel. You did nothing to make us feel like you cared about our unfortunate situation. Not even a free soda:(

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location with comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: hanovertodisney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott for one night. The location was great. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The room was clean, though I did find a hairspray cap from a previous guest under the sink. All of the amenities worked and were in great condition. I felt this hotel was well maintained and would stay here again. In fact, I stayed at another Ocean City hotel the next night and found that the matresses at the Courtyard were far superior in comfort, which can make the world of difference.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: solamour
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with our room in this hotel. Both the sleep area and bath was spacious and comfortable. The hotel location on the boardwalk seemed perfect to me. It was my first visit to Ocean City but I think I made an excellent choice with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more from a Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: WFGlomb
Reviews.Content: As someone who travels for both business and pleasure, I find comfort in using certain hotel chains in locations I have never been to previously. My wife and I planned a road-trip along the East Coast for our honeymoon, and having never been to Ocean City I trusted the brand that is "Courtyard Marriott". The building is newer, and the rooms are clean, however the controlables of service and people skills are lacking at every turn. Upon check-in the woman at the desk was struggling with assigning room keys to any guest that was checking in with no empathy for the guests checking in now being held hostage after traveling. The next day we enjoyed the boardwalk and beach that Ocean City offers, and when returning to our room we realized there was no room service menu. When we called the front desk, we were first told that we were wrong and there was a menu in our room, then were told someone would bring us the menu. After an hour I walked to the front desk to get the menu myself. The next day, while my wife and I were attempting to relax in our room with a "Do Not Disturb" notice on the door we had members of the staff knocking on our door. While I have never worked in the hotel industry I assume the courtesy of "Do Not Disturb" would be taught during the orintation process of new associates. I then received a phone call from the front desk requestig tha I move my wife's car in order for the maintenance team to paint a wall. I remind you that I am on vacation with my new wife to escape the daily tasks that creep in to every day life only to be tasked with some by the people I am paying to help me avoid regular life. Whe I asked to speak to manager when moving the car, I was met with a very unprofessional attitude, and never was able to speak with a member of hotel management. The view is good, there are a variety of things to see and do on the boardwalk, but the trainable customer service at this hotel is seriously lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Will check out other hotels on our next trip”
Reviews.Author: dga75
Reviews.Content: As Courtyards go, this was not the best we've stayed at. My husband travels with business extensively and uses Marriott properties most of the time. The pool was dirty and indoor? The service at the front desk was not as good as other Courtyards. Poor girl had to talk on the phone about a reservations while checking someone else in. We did get the room we wanted, but it was cramped and some wastes space, on the 2nd floor and noisey from other guest as well as the boardwalk. Free internet, did not connect all the time. TV cable signal was bad, could not watch the game we wanted to. The exercise room was good. Parking was free. We probably will not pick this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality and Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandibeach
Reviews.Content: My oceanfront room was very nice, great sunrise every morning, clean and standards of a typical Courtyard Inn. My room was booked as an Oceanfront but when checking in, the front desk person said that none were available… hmmm. I questioned her several times but settled for what I could get. THEN I saw that more than half the oceanfront rooms were empty (May)..I asked the manager, I was quickly changed to room I was suppose to receive. Now service was very good from everyone else and the wait staff in the dining room did a good job. The food is much better than I expected and I was pleasantly surprised with the quality. I would be happy to stay here again if ever in Ocean City but only in an oceanfront room.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, noisy guests”
Reviews.Author: bebedani
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I traveled to ocean city for work and chose the Courtyard, as it is a Marriott property. The rooms were spacious and while I was on a side room, i still had a view of the ocean. The building is newer and has a pool and gym. Upon check in you are required to sign a form that in short states you will be quiet and respectful of other guests. Apparently no one reads this. We were at the hotel on a tuesday before the holiday season and there was already a party going on next door to my co-worker and I had doors banging open and closed until 2:30am. I contacted the front desk and they stated they would send someone. However the noise continued. I could not tell which room it was coming from and this did not help. I dont think ocean city is known as a business city and i hope to not have to travel again here anytime soon. Overall the hotel is nice, the pool is small so expect it to be crowded in the summer, it is also indoor. The bar opens at 10am! And they wonder why people are noisy? they are drunk by noon. They have 2 computers by the front desk for internet access, it was free. I also think there is free internet in the room, but you have to plug in. they offer free coffee, but nothing else. The bed was comfy and while i didnt get to sleep much it did provide a nice place to listen to doors bang.

Reviews.Title: “Balcony is small - Room is plain but clean”
Reviews.Author: BabsMansfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on Marriott Points after staying at the Hilton for 3 nights. We were given an ocean front balcony room. If I had to pay for a room I think I would be disappointed. I have stayed at several Marriott Hotels and found the room small and narrow and the bathroom very small. The only good point was the view of the Ocean and boardwalk. The rooms on the side of the building have no ocean view but face an old hotel building on the side street. The pool is very small and the hotel is like a maze. The lobby and pool are on the 3rd floor and we were on the second. We had to take one elevator up to the third floor to take an elevator to the first floor to our car. Very confusing layout of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Non-ocean front rooms arent worth it.”
Reviews.Author: das34845
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in here ensure a oceanfront room only ,else it is not worth it. I guess I was not vigilant enough while booking. Although , property is beach side , lots of rooms are overlooking the city. As it has just a 3 or 4 floors , the view becomes even less attractive. As it claims to have a balcony , it defeats the purpose as it is too small and transparent and uncovered . This makes it dusty , and impossible to sit. Room service staffs are ill managed I would say .First day they forgot to take care of the bathroom , and on the day of check out , they barged in 3 times while we were getting ready to check out . This was very unpleasant. Other then this , everything else about the hotel is good. Lobby is really great. Ground floor oceanfront rooms were looking good as it had a great view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: bmclark2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty wonderful. We had nice people checking us in. The restaurant is pretty pricey, but the food is REALLY good. The rooms were beautiful. Although we technically had an ocean view, there wasn't much to see (all the hotels on the boardwalk are fairly close, and we were fairly close to the street side of the hotel). The sleep quality was a lower score because of housekeeping. From 8am until I finally gave up on sleeping in, the housekeeping staff was slamming every door in the hallway the entire time. Outside of this, we had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit...Looking forward to my next stay”
Reviews.Author: ocscrapdiva
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Courtyard in Ocean City. It was very nice to be greeted by members of the staff and to be welcomed back. I organize a retreat for 20 - 24 women and love it when I can say that there were no problems and everyone was happy! Great views, extremely clean rooms, friendly attentive staff. Special thanks to Ed, Tasha, Lauren, Spencer at the front desk who took care of our every need. See you in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & cozy”
Reviews.Author: budandpapaoceancity
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, the hotel receptionist was very helpful. Complaints, the rooms need to be made more soundproof (we could hear every word from the persons in the next rooms, especially when walking in the halls); the indoor hot tub & pool temperatures need to be higher, the temperature in the hot tub was the same as the pool; and no freezer area in the very small refridgerator! Anthony "Papa" & Rosa "Bud" Jones

Reviews.Title: “impressed”
Reviews.Author: kjwmd
Reviews.Content: I didn't know there were hotels this nice in OCMD. New, clean, and got a great deal on price line. Balcony was nice, free parking is great. Door to the room was a little sticky and needed some coaxing to close.

Reviews.Title: “Bait & Switch Rooms. Snooty Reservationists! Big disappointment overall.”
Reviews.Author: EarthyBarbara
Reviews.Content: In January 2011, I called the Courtyard Marriott in Ocean City, Maryland, and booked a room for 2 nights on February 19 & 20. I specifically asked the reservationist for an oceanfront room on a higher floor. I wanted to ensure a nice view of the ocean. Low and behold when I received an e-mail confirmation from the hotel I noticed our room was on the ground floor. Not only is there no view of the ocean, the ground floors do not even have a balcony, just a patio on the boardwalk level. I called the Marriott and inquired as to why our reservation was for a ground floor room when I had asked for a higher floor. The reservationist said she had no way of knowing what floor our room was on when making our reservation. This didn't make any sense to me. I asked the reservationist to please move us to an oceanfront room on a higher floor. She replied that she could not do this because the hotel was sold out, but that she would make this notation on our reservation. I called the Marriott a week or so later and asked the reservationist if someone had cancelled and if we were placed in a room on a higher floor. The response I received was that nothing will be done until the day of check-in! I tried calling back a few other times spaced apart and kept getting the same response, "nothing will be done until the day of check-in." In other words, even if someone should cancel a room on a higher floor, the Marriott would not move our reservation to that floor. The reservationists I dealt with were sarcastic, rude and very unhelpful. I was treated like pond scum by the Marriott reservationists. This situation was so totally unsatisfactory that I accessed the Marriott Corporation website and sent an e-mail to customer service regarding this matter. Within about 15 minutes, I received a website inquiry reply indicating that our reservation had been moved to a higher floor! I was very impressed with the can-do attitude of the customer service representative. So, all along my reservation could have been on a higher floor, but the Marriott reservationists would not accommodate my request. Now, about the Courtyard Marriott hotel in Ocean City, Maryland. Although we stay in Ocean City at least 20 times a year, this was our first stay at the Marriott. It will be our last. The first thing I noticed was next door to us on the fourth floor there was a motorcycle gang wearing their leather jackets with "Colors." I have nothing against motorcyclists, however, this group was rowdy. Another gang of motorcyclists had a room(s) on the ground floor and were sitting out on the patio level. They were hollering up to each other and throwing things at each other like children. They were drinking and smoking smelly cigars (smoking is not prohibited on the balconies or patio). We booked the Marriott for a nice quiet holiday weekend, but this didn't appear to be the case. Be advised that the balcony’s are not private. They set out from the exterior of the hotel with small glass siding. You can see and hear everything from the other balconies on each side, above and below. There is no privacy whatsoever. Now, on to the pool area. When I first called the Marriott I asked if there was a Jacuzzi adjacent to the swimming pool. The reservationist said yes, there was a Jacuzzi. If you look on the hotel website, you'll see a round tub adjacent to the pool. However, we found out when we went to the pool that this was not a Jacuzzi, but called a "Conversation Pit." Much to my dismay, the water temperature in the Conversation Pit was barely lukewarm. The pool water was actually warmer than the Jacuzzi. I had hoped to get some therapy from the hot water jets for a knee injury sustained from slipping on the ice. Well, that didn't happen. There was no hot water and the few jets were very weak. Oh, don't let the wide-angle lens photo of the swimming pool fool you on their website. The swimming pool is nothing more than an oversized bathtub. We also found out that there is only one swimming pool on the hotel premises. In the warmer months, expect the tiny swimming pool to be filled with people along with the "Conversation Pit." You have been warned! The guests and even hotel staff joked about the "Conversation Pit" disguised as a Jacuzzi. Now, about the hotel room. If you like staying in mobile home trailers, this hotel room is for you! Our two-Queen room was long and very narrow. So much so that I felt a little claustrophobic. The bathroom is standard with a small countertop around the sink. The towels were small and thin with little absorbency. We were not offered terrycloth robes in this room. The shower head leaked down the tiles and onto the floor. The bathroom floor was dirty as I noted from wiping water off the floor from the leaky shower head with a white towel. There were quite a few marks (dirt) on the walls which could have been wiped down for aesthetics. The small refrigerator is very tiny. You can barely get a few sodas or bottles of water in this fridge. It's the smallest hotel fridge we have ever seen! Forget trying to get a half-gallon of milk in this fridge. It's nearly impossible. There is no place in the fridge for any food. Just a few beverages. The Marriott has signs all over the hotel advertising "The Captain's Table Restaurant” in the hotel. Therefore, they discourage guests from bringing food to the hotel by providing the tiny fridge. There is no table and chairs in the room in which to sit and eat food. Again, the hotel wants you to eat in their restaurant. (That's another story). There is a small table for a computer keyboard which we pulled out and then placed the two balcony chairs around in order to sit and have some cheese and crackers during our stay. We had to think out of the box for that one. So far as furniture, you only have one computer chair, one living room chair, a long credenza, night stand and dresser drawers. The hotel rooms are not very well appointed. There were no pictures on the long wall over the head of the beds or on the walls, expect for one overtop the small fridge area. There were three small black & white photos glued to a wooden ledge overtop the credenza. That's it so far as accessories in the hotel room, except for a floor lamp. There are no windows in the room expect for the balcony doors. There are very bright lights on each balcony which stay on all day/night. You have to close the drapes at night to prevent the bright light from shining into the room keeping you awake. Not good. When my husband and I retired for the evening we slept in the two Queen beds. I could not believe how bad my bed smelled! It reeked of perspiration. So much so that I had to sniff each pillow to determine which one had the least odor. It was a tough call because all the pillows smelled badly. So did the bed linens, especially the thin comforter. It was as though a team of Suma wrestlers slept in the beds after a match, with no showers. The hotel does not use pillow covers or double-up the pillow cases. Hence, the pillows are full of perspiration. The smell became embedded in my nose and throat for nearly 24 hours afterwards. I could hardly sleep and keep from gagging. The beds were comfortable, but what good does it do you when they smell so bad? The Marriott should use Febreeze on the bed linens or Baking Soda in the washing machines to help rid the smell. The hotel offers satellite TV. You do not have the usual cable channels in other Ocean City hotels and there is no local weather station or visitor information channels/guides. It was a windy weekend and the satellite signal kept going in and out. There is a clock radio in which you could not set the correct time. The clock was off by 20 minutes. It's the type of clock radio in which the time automatically sets itself, but obviously that wasn't working. About the "Captain's Table Restaurant" at the Marriott hotel. We dined there once, but never again! There were only two other tables in use and the rest of the dining area was empty. We asked the host for a booth and he snapped at us saying we could not sit at a booth, as these were for more than two people! We almost waked out, but decided to give it a go. Big mistake!
