Then the host placed a couple with several children right next to us. The children were screaming to the tops of their lungs. We then asked our server to be moved to another table. My husband and I both ordered the (expensive) Filet Mignon. Both Filet’s were dry (no juice) and tough. I have never seen a Filet Mignon that did not have a little juice or wasn’t moist. These were dry as dust and total waste of money. This, despite the fact that my husband ordered his Filet Mignon “medium rare.” I ordered the Filet with Crab Imperial on the top. I found that the crabmeat was Asian and tasted very fishy-like. Most restaurants in Ocean City, Maryland, serve "Blue Crabmeat," but the Marriott serves Asian. It was gross and inedible. Be aware that there is no view whatsoever of the ocean or Bay-side at the hotel restaurant. What you see out the windows are the backside of other hotels and a gross swimming pool with stagnant water. That's it! Many O.C. restaurants have a view, especially of the picturesque Bay-side. Oh, well. More points lost for the Courtyard Marriott in Ocean City, Maryland. During summer months, expect to pay $400 to $500+ per night for a hotel room at the Courtyard Marriott in Ocean City, Maryland. There are much better hotels at a more affordable rate, especially with larger swimming pools (both inside and outside). There is little, if any, recreation for children at this hotel. This concludes my review of the Courtyard Marriott in Ocean City, Maryland. I hope you have found this information to be useful when planning your next trip. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birdman0429
Reviews.Content: This hotel had to fit into a narrow lot, so some of the space issues mentioned in other reviews, including the cramped parking under the hotel, are a result of that. There is an open parking lot across the street. I liked the decor, the bed, the bathroom with marble counters, the clock radio that actually pulled in NPR, and it seemed quiet. On the minus side, the bathroom was missing a mirror from the back of the door, and taking a shower set off the smoke alarm, which was pretty annoying. False alarms can happen if the smoke alarm is mounted too close to the bathroom. No one else mentioned this happening in their review so perhaps the smoke alarm in my room was defective.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay to much control”
Reviews.Author: graves1336
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay at. The only problem I have with the hotel is it has a lot of rules. I am a 50 year old person and they tell me what I can do in my room that I just paid $149.00 for in the month of January and even make you sign a piece of paper. (don't smoke but I would like to have a beer or two). It was too cold to even go to the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott is very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hi_kity
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on several occasions. It's always a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: mbfmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rehoboth Beach for years, but when a Marriott opened in OCMD (the only one in the area), my Marriott-point-obsessed hubby decided we should give it a shot. Not only did we find it a much brighter, cleaner hotel with more amenities than the ones at the Delaware beaches, but we love the restaurant. Our kids go nuts for the pool, too. Since we only travel to the beach off-season, these things are very important. We love having a room that faces the ocean so we can see and hear the waves, and in the late fall/winter it's a very affordable option. While we don't really care for Ocean City, we just can't stay away because we like this hotel so much (and we keep asking,"Why couldn't this hotel be in Rehoboth? It would be pure bliss!"). (My husband does has a small complaint though: he has stayed in dozens of Marriotts across the country on business and says that the towels and pillows in OCMD aren't "up to Marriott standards." I didn't notice, however.) Thanks for another great weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, Checked and checked out though”
Reviews.Author: TAmember10
Reviews.Content: I have to start by giving all credit to this property and the staff for good customer service. However, I checked in and checked out 10 minutes later. Unfortunately, I was looking for a place where I could spend thankgsgiving weekend relaxing and occasionally watching the ocean waves from my room, as realistically, there isn't much else to do this time of the year. I was given a non-ocean front room, facing another motel and a sneak peek of the ocean. Check in personnel were very friendly, but clarified they did not have ocean front rooms available. When I got to the room, it just didnt fit my needs above. For the record, room was very clean and fresh. But since I had been told there were no ocean front rooms, I quickly made a reservation at the Hilton, then called the Courtyard's front desk to let them know I was checking out. Surprisingly, they said there was a ocean front room available if I was willing to stay. Unfortunately, the Hilton reservation had to be prepaid, so it was too late. I am both Marriott and Hilton rewards guest, hence switch between the two. So for the record, this is a nice and well maintained property, but not all rooms are ocean front if that is what you are looking for, again depending on the season. During summer, I guess this is a non issue. Would I stay again or recommend? yes, in winter if you get ocean front room. Can't pretend to be an authority about summer though.

Reviews.Title: “awful weather wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: franklynM
Reviews.Content: I came at the end of september and the beginning of october and the weather was overcast with occasional showers.But the hotel made up for it.Great room great staff.To say that parking was in the basement is not correct unless you note that the basement is the first floor open on all sides.I read the reviews about the indoor parking and was concerned about getting into a space.Ihad planned on using the spillover lot.There was no problem at all.The restaurant was very good although at times I had to instruct the waiters on obtaining things (one young man did not know that bread came with the meal). Dumners had great ice cream but mediocre food,Da Vincis was altogether mediocre.Peppers next door was great. Ocean City is too old for me I prefer Virginia Beach or Rehoboth,but this Courtyard was a worthwhile gem.

Reviews.Title: “no surprises”
Reviews.Author: crloganphila
Reviews.Content: the hotel met expectations. clean and employees helpfu.l convenient location. we were able to park an oversized pickup in the garage. inside pool is small. spa is pool water warm, not hot tub temperature. great view of ocean/beach from ocean side room balcony. food was very good in the hotel restaurant but sunday breakfast seemed too busy for number of staff on hand in restaurant,

Reviews.Title: “What a great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: mawallace13546
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, you are greeted by a recently built Courtyard, featuring modern décor and fresh surroundings. There are four floors. The best, I think, is the third floor because you have same floor access to the front desk, the pool (which is warm and unique in that the Jacuzzi spills out into the main pool), the fitness room and the restaurant. If you can, try to get an ocean view. Watching the waves crash down and the surfers skillfully ply their way along them was such a treat. Sitting out one the balcony is also a great way to relax, listen to the waves and people walking by. In general, the room was clean, everything worked, décor was up-to-date and relaxing. Try out the bar and restaurant. Great food, good happy hour prices and nice atmosphere. Was really great not to have to get into the car to eat and relax. Afterwards, we just walked back to our room. Hotel's location is outstanding! You are seconds from the boardwalk and all the stores, etc. Parking is free and ample. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Within a 20 minute drive, there are nearby cities that also offer attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing...”
Reviews.Author: zosim
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in Ocean City, and I made sure I booked at the Marriott. Considering a lot of the hotels in the area is very outdated, this one was a refreshing sight. Will surely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: nimeria
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked two nights at the Marriott OC for $60/night through a priceline bid. Every room in this immaculately clean hotel has it's own balcony with an ocean view but if I had to do it all over again, I'd definitely shell out a little more money to get the ocean front rooms. Room 212 had an odd mechanical noise in the room. It was as if you were in a giant washing machine. Our saving grace was the ipod docking station that helped put my 2 year old son to sleep. However, Tiasha from the front desk was gracious enough to give us a new QUIET room in the third floor (311). I highly recommend this room if you were on a budget like us. The view was so much better, it's near the lobby and it was right across the access for the pool, patio and work out room. And since the room was right next door to the Captain's Table, room service was insanely quick! It took less than 10 minutes for our breakfast to be delivered to our door. The location of the hotel was wonderful. It's right on the boardwalk, within walking distance to almost everything imaginable. However, since my family and I stayed there in the off peak - almost everything was CLOSED including most of the shops, restaurants and rides on the boardwalk. Lauren from the front desk was an absolute god sent. She literally paged through the phone book to find restaurants that were open and even made a couple of phone calls. This resulted in the best pizza we've had in a while: Fat Daddy's vegetarian gourmet pizza! The beach directly off the hotel was fabulous. We saw two huge dolphins not too far away from us! Overall, the staff of this Marriott was what made our vacation so much better than it could have been. Everybody was very warm and cordial. When I called the hotel to tell them I lost my camera, Ed from reception sounded more excited than me when he found it. He had told me that he was going nuts trying to figure out how to contact me since they didn't have my address (I've prepaid through priceline). The manager even called expedia, hotwire and priceline to see if they could give him my home number... now that's customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful interior, great location”
Reviews.Author: madmbtfly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a few years old and is very modern in its decor. The layout is unique and the hotel is clean. The location is quite picturesque, as well. Right on the boardwalk but not too close to the chaos of the inlet. Highly recommended as a nice stay at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: unic977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice and clean..... it's a little on the pricey side but the rooms are big and clean, will definitely stay there again. The restaurant has great food as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great experience”
Reviews.Author: wendynemo
Reviews.Content: I lived there one night over the summer with my parents. The hotel is on the beach, and I love the room decoration. Everything was great. It was a great experience for my family. We can see the beach from our balcony. I will definitly live there again.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional place by the sea”
Reviews.Author: retiredmother
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard by Marriott in Ocean City, MD is a wonderful place for a vacation by the sea. It is situated on the boardwalk and faces the Atlantic Ocean. The exercise room, the indoor swimming pool, and the rooms are very clean and wonderful. Most importantly, the staff is friendly, helpful, and extremely polite. Because of the gracious staff, we have come to the hotel many times in the past year. During our first visit, in September 2009, we were so impresssed with Kelly Taylor. She was very very cordial. Then, we became acquainted with Edward Lewis. He is awesome and so helpful and always makes us feel important. Everyone at the front desk is great. Tasha Brittingham always has a smile and greets us cheerfully whenever we see her. And, new to the staff is lovely Lauren Brissey. She is indeed a welcome addition. Believe it or not, everyone at the front desk greets us by our names! Wow!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!! Don't stay anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: mikeflemings
Reviews.Content: Great hospitality and customer service by Ms. Lauren Brissey who works and helps to manage check in/check out at the front desk. She also knew that I was a servicemember and thanked me for the service to our country. She was quite charming and made sure we were checked in early with no delay. Every time I inquired about what I considered to be little things (ie. not enough face cloths, shower caps, local events), Lauren stepped up her service to a whole new level. She ensured my check in was smooth, friendly, and welcomed me as a VIP silver member at the Marriott. I truly felt special staying there for the wine/jazz fest that was happening locally and it was a true vacation staying there. The happy hour at the bar was wonderful and the food was soooo delicious...especially breakfast and dinner. I highly recommend the french toast and the crab filled omelette. By the way, the hotel balcony was superb and the layout included a nice pool and conversational pit which was nice and secluded, a nice and private workout area with treadmills which includes cable television for your listening and viewing pleasure and a wonderful sun deck which is more enjoyable with the superb margaritas provided by the bar. It is a true vacation staying at this Marriott and I can't wait to come back to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: JD313
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay although early check-in was not possible. Staff offered us to use the hotel's changing rooms to go to the pool or beach which was nice. Since it was a busy weekend they also could not give us a King room instead of two doubles which we were forced to book due to the great rate we took advantage of. Our gripes: 1) The door for our bathroom struck the door frame (warped?). 2) The toilet wobbled back and forth when sitting on it. 3) We noticed the day we were leaving that the air conditioner leaked water all over the carpet by the balcony. 4) Our neighbors were extremely noisy and they had a child who was out of control and we were given a room with the connecting door (without being forewarned). All in all the room was clean, the staff was friendly, and location was excellent. I would certainly stay here again. It was the newest hotel on the boardwalk and I have yet to have a horrible stay at a Courtyard. Side note: The breakfast at the Captain's Table was reasonably priced and a great meal!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel...you can get more for your money elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: traveling81
Reviews.Content: Me and wife stayed at this hotel the 3rd weekend of August. I BADLY wanted to like this hotel. Me and my wife always stay at the Holiday inn on 17th and Suites or the Hilton Suites, We wanted to make a quick get away, and since the two above we booked, we ended up here. Ocean City has a lot of nastiy hotels, and we figured being new, it has to be passable. First off from a architectural standpoint the hotal is simply awesome looking. One of the nicest looking hotels in Ocean City for sure. That being said, the design is a complete clustersmurf. The parking sucks, and the pool is small and in the middle of the hotel vs. the boardwalk. The layout is confusing, the balcony's are small and "intimate" with your neighbors. We were on the 3rd floor that runs along the pool, and the hallway in front of our room was constantly congested and seemed dity. Our neighbors has wet bathing suits and dirty room service dishes on the floor outside the room. The walls seemed thin. The basic place this hotel fails bad is value. Had I paid $200 or $250 a night for it, I would be a 100% happy camper. However at $369-$389 a night, all I kept thinking was how for $60-70 bucks more I could have had a suite at the Hilton. Matter of fact, right now, I am sitting in a two room corner suite on labor day weekend. Suite has a seperate living room, full kitchen with granite, big screen tv, and huge balcony. Not to mention the 3 pools and what not. I paid $459 a night for this room on a holiday weekend. Once your spending the money the Courtyard wants, you would be stupid not to find the few extra dollars to do the hilton or Holiday Inn Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great view for the money, Not so much a great room”
Reviews.Author: _msmayor_nyc
Reviews.Content: I love Ocean City - however this is my first time staying on the beachside and I would do it again...although the room wasn't great it did have the best ocean view ever - the room was stock with a refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot - but thoughout the day the have complimentary coffee and lemonade. On the downside (sorry) the parking was crazy and if you have a truck even worse - the pool was tiny and indoor - which I guess works in the colder months. I also thougth the layout was strange the entrance from the street and where the lobby was strange - but the staff was nice - roomy space and we had a balcony that was just fab!

Reviews.Title: “nice place but a few safety hazards”
Reviews.Author: ocdreaming
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed a week at the beginning of august, on our second day there I fell in the hallway which has tile floor. At first I thought it was water, only to discover it was something oily on the floor. I went to the front desk to report the problem and was told that they had been having prblems with teenagers putting something in the pool to make bubbles, i did not realize at the time that i was speaking with the general manager.the next day i had to be taken to urgent care as my knee was the size of a melon and solid black and blue. the hotel offered no concession . and we ended up covering the urgent care bill out of our pocket. the staff definately needs to be trained in what to do if a guest is hurt on property

Reviews.Title: “Beware! BEDBUGS, snarky desk clerk, all night bright lights on the balconey”
Reviews.Author: glory215
Reviews.Content: Our room was attractive, and expensive. I was willing to pay extra for ocean view and a no drama trip with my husband and little grandson. First off, we arrived at 6:30 exhausted to find the single desk clerk giving a family what became a 20 minute rundown of every eatery and it's menu. After that family left, and we were finally able to check in, another desk clerk mysteriously appeared from behind a wall and asked if she could help us. The first clerk, who waited on us, was clearly annoyed that we didn't take her up on it. We got to our room, (not on the top floor as we requested) and it was well appointed and satisfactory. Problem was, at 4 am we were being eaten alive by BEDBUGS! They refunded our money, found us another hotel, but rented out the same room to a new family a half hour after we left, no fumigation. I saw them on the balconey of this $359 a night room, I'm sure thinking they paid for quality. I should have yelled up.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay here in two years - would do it again tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: MHS70
Reviews.Content: My wife and two young children stayed for 4 nights in early August. This is our 2nd time at the Courtyard - we went last year in August as well - just after it's grand opening. We had a wonderful time and would come back again; however, I say this having not actually paid for the hotel since I used Marriot rewards certificates. To be honest, I could not see myself paying $459 (the rate I would have paid for my oceanfront room) per night. That's not a knock on this hotel, per se, but if I'm going to pay that for a family vacation, I would hop on a plane and go to the Atlantis in the Bahamas or something. Having said that - the hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, the restaurant is great and the rooms are very nice, spacious and comfortable. Each day the sand-filled room was refreshed like new - great housekeeping staff. People complain about the parking here - yes it's tight but it's manageable if you're a decent parker. If you don't like a tight squeeze, there's convenient parking across the street. Also, some people have complained about the small pool - yes it's small but with an 8 and 10 year old, (and last year when they were 7 and 9) they wanted nothing to do with the pool when there's a beautiful beach just steps away. Regarding bike rentals - support the little guy. On 16th street there is a really nice guy whose bikes are a bit aged but you save a buck or two and there's no waiting. If you go to the one on/about 8th street, it's mobbed with a line of people waiting for bikes that are a bit shinier.

Reviews.Title: “Big Money”
Reviews.Author: WolverineFl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weeks ago and found the hotel to be a two year old 60s style place.The quality of the furnishings in the rooms could not have been cheaper i felt like a was surrounded by paper furniture. I had not been to Ocean City in probably 40 years and do not remember it being such a dump. Any way the hotel is clean it's on the board walk but it ain't cheap over $400 per night for a city view.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach front location”
Reviews.Author: RegularFamilyTeam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location right on the Ocean City, MD boardwalk directly facing the beach. The room was clean and fully functional. The only down side was that the parking under the hotel is impossible for parking a mid-sized SUV. We parked in the lot across the street and found it to be no problem. The biggets issue was that there is no bell hop or doorman service to help with bags, etc. You are completely on your own. The doormen just read the newspaper and tell you where you might go looking for a baggage cart. The front desk staff are adequate, but let you know that they do not want to be bothered with just about anything. If you want a great location on the Ocean City boardwalk near the beach that is very clean, but has a few minor issues and you are willing to pay a premium for location and cleanliness then this a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bill60811
Reviews.Content: I stay all over the country in Marriott properties (and others) and this hotel has the most professional staff I have ever encountered. The property is meticulously maintained and everything about the stay was perfect! During the entire stay every one of my requests was answered by a "yes." The staff is obviously trained in customer service and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, SERVICE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steelerfan023
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to OC MD. The Courtyard is only about a year old and looks as wonderful as it must have on opening day. We arrived early approx 1:00pm, our room wasn't ready but the person at the front desk said she would call my cell when the room was ready, that I should take my family down to the Beach, the call came within the hour. The service just keeps getting better. Later in our stay we had to switch rooms (rewards points thing) and the front desk was so very accomadating that we were able to stay in our Ocean Front room the entire stay. Every time I pased the front desk I was greeted by name. Also, there is not a better location in all of OC if you have children, mine are 11 & 14. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindy46732
Reviews.Content: Our room was perfect and the staff was so helpful and friendly, from check-in to finding a restaurant. The location couldn't be better. It is so nice to have a Marriott in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Oncman
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by stating I'm a Marriott Platinum member and am very loyal to Marriott. This is our 2nd stay at the property and as Courtyards go, it's great. As a hotel for vacationing families, not so much. The rooms are smaller then most Courtyards, the pool is not much bigger then a hot tub and the parking for even the smallest of SUV's is a challenge. All that said, the location is terrific, the service was fine and the on site restaurant is among the best in OC. Mid week check in was a breeze, room was clean and ready. Daily housekeeping service was prompt and efficient and request for extra towels, soap ect were quickly addressed. Rooms have free wi fi which for teenage daughter is a must. Last year we were fortunate enough to have a 1st floor room on the boardwalk. This year a second floor room with a glipse of the beach. Well worth it to pay the extra for the beachfront rooms... As with other reviews, I agree that elevator set up is confusing. One is hidden in the back of the hotel, another only goes from parking garage to lobby and two others will take you to the room floors. Overall the great location, clean rooms and good service more then makes up for some of the quirks of the property. We will be back again in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, better for business then for families.”
Reviews.Author: SunanBeach
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifus and clean. very comtempory which i like. The issues we had were the elevators were very confusing as only one went to the second floor. I also felt they were short staff and when we called for 2 more wash(they stock 2 in the bath room and their were 4 of us) cloths they staff brought me hand towels and said they we short on wash clothes. The restuarant was ok, a bit pricey and when ordering oatmeal w/banana's which was on the menu, they said they did not have any banana's. Asked for a glass of milk with a lid and they didn't have any. A goblet of milk does not work for a toddler, just not children friendly. We had issues with our key cards to get into our room. When i returned one of them to the front desk, she said if the cards we laying on other credit cards it could de-activate them. Our cards were never against other cards. The parking spots were so tiny, so if you have a SUV, figure on getting one of your doors dinged, which we did. All and all like i said the hotel was nice but in my opinion a bit too pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!! Location, Room, Service!”
Reviews.Author: HonestLadyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and i are both teachers and decided to celebrate our first weekend off of school with a trip to the beach! We got an AMAZING deal at this hotel through priceline, by naming our own price and choosing a 3 star option for ocean city, md. We stayed in room 410, which was a side room - but still had an ocean view from our balcony. We stayed for two nights. When we arrived to the hotel (about 1:30) we were just looking to park our car, but we were happily surprised to find out that our room was available for early check in! We went into the room to find a SPOTLESS bathroom and hotel room. The beds were comfortable with LOTS of pillows! On our second day in the hotel the staff came in to clean, vacuum, mop the bathroom, change the linens, and deliver fresh towels. I went for a run and came back to find the housekeeping staff JUST finishing up with the mopping - perfect timing! The location was unbeatable. We were within walking distance to everything (including Phillips my husbands FAVORITE!) and right on the boardwalk. The one and only thing I could say that was not good was that there was a little bit of noise that traveled through the rooms and the hallway, nothing that was overly loud but we could notice it. Also, there is no included breakfast - but there is coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: robw69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. This is supposed to be a 3 star hotel. I would rate is a 1.5 tops. The beds are very uncomfortable, the rooms are dirty, and the tv reception is spotty at best. We were there for 5 days and not once was our bathroom floor or toilet cleaned. The only thing the maid servive did was give us towels and make the bed. The parking is also a problem. There are not nearly enough spaces and they are only big enough for compact cars. If you have a truck or an SUV forget it. The pool os also bad. it is closed in and is only big enough for 4 or 5 people. if you are going to spend the money on a 3 star, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST perfect”
Reviews.Author: COCO_CLASSIC
Reviews.Content: I recently booked an impromptu trip as a belated birthday gift for my 13 year old daughter. She'd never been to Ocean City and since I'm a Marriott Rewards Member I figured I'd use my points and I'm really glad I did. To start with, most of the rooms are "ocean view" but I wanted an "ocean front" room. This cannot always be guaranteed but when I called and spoke with Brandon, not only did he put in the request for me he also was kind enough to have a card and small gift bag put in the room. (NOTE: this is NOT standard practice). He also suggested I call back the following morning to see if my request was granted. When I called the next morning I spoke with Ed and he assured me he was working on it since it was a "special occasion" and would do his best. I must admit they exceeded my expectations. Check-in was a breeze with Ed was at the front desk. We arrived @ 2:30, check in isn’t until 4 pm but our room was ready. YIPPIE SKIPPE! We stayed in room 322 (3rd floor) which is on the same floor as the lobby, across from entrances to pool, exercise room and laundry room. You'd think with all the activity going on it'd be really noisy but thankfully it wasn’t. I didn’t hear a peep outside of my room door. The room was big and CLEAN with 2 double beds, lounge chair and a balcony that faced the ocean with 2 chairs. The view was absolutely amazing and made me even more glad I was so persistent with my request. The hotel is centrally located on 15th street which is where all the "action" really begins. It was great exercise to walk all the way down to the beginning of the boardwalk and back daily. It gets really crowded but that's what happens when you go during "senior week" (total accident). It also got pretty noisy outside when I left my balcony door open but once I shut it; BLISS. They have a restaurant onsite which we didn’t go to. The prices were a little high but the food surely smelled good. Not sure what the complaints are about the underground parking. I didn’t have an issue parking my car and I drive a Camry which is considered full size. Maybe being from NYC I'm used to it or maybe those that complained simply can’t drive or park well. The lobby served lemonade on Saturday next to the coffee stand but not sure what happened Sunday and Monday. Maybe it's only a weekend thing? Also, if you want some of the comp coffee, get there early. Both days when I went to get some the carafe was empty. Can’t really blame the hotel; they we're sold out and it is a complimentary service they provide. The pool was more of a large tub with a bath tub attached. Kind of annoying when you have 10 people trying to swim in it but hey, you've got a huge ocean out there so why only stay at the pool? Besides seeing the young kids learn to swim was too cute! There is a staircase by the pool which leads to a walk way for the beach; super easy access. NOTE: You are not allowed to bring hotel towels down to the beach so please remember to bring your own from home or buy them at one of the many shops on the Boardwalk. The ONLY reason the hotel isn’t getting a rating of 5 is they entered my room and cleaned it even though I had the "do not disturb" sign up. Of course some people wouldn’t have a problem with this but I value my privacy and I put the sign up there for a reason. That’s one of my BIGGEST pet peeves and a sure way to knock off 1 point when I do a review. All in all it was a great experience and this is a great hotel. I wouldn’t have paid the advertised price ($468 a night? WHOA!) But using my points I'll definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCJenny
Reviews.Content: Hotel had everything we needed. The rooms were roomy and quiet (it was "Senior Week" and there were teenagers staying in the rooms on either side of us...never heard them!). The beds were comfortable. Bathroom was clean and well stocked. We opted not to have our room made up and the housekeeping staff left fresh towels and toiletries in a bag on our doorknob (very nice touch). The staff was very friendly. There is ample parking. It is very conveniently located. We were able to park our car and leave it for the duration of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iLove2vacay
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I wanted to get away for the weekend, and was able to get a decent rate at this hotel. The reviews were good, but we never visited OC so we didn't know what to expect. The hotel was a nice surprise, well lit and very clean from the outside. There weren't many parking spaces but you could park directly across the street, so it wasn't too bad. We had a smooth check in and the desk attendant was nice and helpful. We got in kind of late and didn't know where to eat, the manager on duty gave us a menu to one of his favorite places and it worked out perfectly with them delivering right to our room. I was surprised how warm the pool was, usually they are freezing but it was the perfect temp for me and our toddler. There's a nice weight room right next to the pool with a nice sized flat panel TV. The room service was great, we ordered breakfast which was delivered very fast and tasted well. We called down to the front desk a few times for different things and everyone was extremely sweet. I was told that the hotel was completely sold out but couldn't tell because it was very quiet. Overall it was a great hotel for what we needed, a quiet relaxing weekend. Will definitely stay here again. Loved the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: ctbeach
Reviews.Content: we just came back from our stay in ocean city at the Mariott. Still off season so not crowded. Everything was great. We had an oceanview with balcony, rooms were clean, bed was comfy, internet access in rooms and in the lobby. Staff very nice. A great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard by Marriott in Ocean City is GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLynnMaryland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott in Ocean City Maryland, last weekend and it was wonderful!!! The Front desk staff was very helpful. We arrived 2 hours earlier than check in time and our room was ready, so that was nice. We asked if the room had a balcony and it did not, so they found us a room that did have one and it was lovely. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. There was a great view of the boardwalk and ocean from the balcony. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was very quiet. We never heard any noise from other guests. There is a restaurant at the hotel, called the Captain's Table and it was excellent! We ate breakfast, lunch and a dinner there and cannot say enough about how great the food and service was. The portions are generous and the prices are reasonable. The waitresses were very pleasant and friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Right next door is also a restaurant called Davinci's By The Sea, which has great Italian food. The Pool area is lovely although it was a little too chilly to use while we were there. There is a covered parking area for your car, with an overflow lot close by. The hotel has only been open since July 2009, so it is still fairly new, but it seems to be very well managed and everything was great during our stay. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a very nice hotel in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: habersack
Reviews.Content: I am Marriott Gold and stay 70 nights per year in Marriott properties. This property is excellent and a great value. Good to be right on the boardwalk! The Captain's Table Restaurant is located on property and a great place to dine.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of attention to details.”
Reviews.Author: Gamertravels
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Courtyard Marriott properties. I agree with the exceptional value of price, location, beach access, modern and up to date compared to the rest of the city, etc.   During our stay we had two fire drills requiring evacuation two days in a row and on the third of our fourth day of stay, construction in the privately owned condos on the 5th floor.   During reservations and at check in at 11p on our day of arrival I specifically indicated we were on our third honeymoon.  We were placed in a room between two babies which makes for not so hot honeymoon ambiance to a childless couple. I was asked if we enjoyed our balloons and gift from the hotel that was not present in my room. I was told it must have been overlooked, which I guess I was supposed to take as they were going to continue to overlook it as we never received anything.  The night person was extremely sweet and accomodating.   In terms of our room the fixtures, furniture, beds, etc were all the highest you expect when it comes to a Courtyard, however the bathroom was lacking. Toothpaste splatters on the door and under the mirror, splatters of unknown on the wall under the toilet paper, on the picture on the wall and on the frosted glass in the shower stall. Leftover razor case cover in the shower along with some mold on the shower curtain and some leftover hairs on the walls just showed a blatent lack of attention to detail. Lastly a glass with cigarettes on the balcony and poorly cleaned sliding glass doors and multiple questionable stains on the carpet just left an overall ugh feeling of the room. TV doesn't have on demand or it was a mystery to access it by two tech-savvy individuals.  I swam at the pool which was ok but I agree could never handle a rainy day during the summer. There are no amenities in the changing rooms including a bench or hooks on the walls or a shower curtain to keep the water from getting all over the floor.   A simple review of the rooms and the property could easily create a list of simple cleaning changes or amenity review could make a huge difference at this property when it comes to the details.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: seagull88
Reviews.Content: We booked ajoining rooms for ourselves and our extended family. We had oceanfront rooms and that had a small balcony area that would be nice during the summer months. Great place!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Guest rooms and comman areas were very clean and quite tastfully decorated. The lobby has two large screen computers with full internet access. We were there in December so the hotel was not terribly busy but still had a good number of people staying. We enjoyed both breakfast and dinner at the restaurant which is a true restraurant.....no cafeteria feel. The food was wonderful and the waitstaff was very kind. There is also a full bar with TV so the guys in our group could enjoy "the game". The pool/hot tub area was wonderful with walls of windows all around. There are 2 changing areas with showers and 2 separate bathrooms next to the pool area. Overall, it was a very comfortable/ positive experience. We did not feel trapped in our rooms as the hotel has great comman spaces to sit, relax, and enjoy a drink or read the paper. In the summer the location would be ideal....right on the boardwalk!!

Reviews.Title: “This is our new go-to place in Ocean City!”
Reviews.Author: Coppercat
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at the Courtyard. I have been traveling for business for 20 years, and I am very particular about hotels. This property is just beautiful - still looks and smells brand new, rooms are huge and extremely clean, and you can't beat the location. I would have been perfectly content just staying in the room all weekend - that's how inviting it was. It has been my experience that most of the hotels in OC are pretty run-down, so we were pleasantly surprised with the Courtyard. For those familiar with Courtyards, don't expect the usual breakfast buffet - this property has an actual sit-down restaurant that serves food all day. We only went there for breakfast, but the food was fresh, delicous and very reasonably priced. Trust me, you can't go wrong at the Courtyard!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great price”
Reviews.Author: Flyersfan090
Reviews.Content: Stayed New Years Eve and New Yrs Day Nite. Just opened in July so everything is quite new. A really nice room, great location. Use Priceline and bid the room. I think I had the best deal in OCMD. Would stay again and recommend, though at the reduced priceline price. The normal rate for OCMD in the winter is high.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service. Embarassing.”
Reviews.Author: LineMountain
Reviews.Content: I am a longtime Marriott silver elite member with over 120k points. I stayed at the OC MD property the first week it was open in August 2009 and paid around $180 a night. The location is nice and the decor and property was brand new. I reserved several rooms for summer 2010 at the “long term stay rate” which was 7 nights. Six months later in December 2009 I was charged a one night deposit for one of the reservations. I had to call silver elite customer service who indicated I should not have had my card charged for that reservation or any of my other reservations. After two phone calls to Marriott I received a response from the OC MD hotel manager indicating they were charging one night deposits for summer 2010 but he was refunding my card. He acted like he was doing me a favor by dropping the requirement even though it was clearly NOT in my rate rules and I had never been charged a one night deposit before in seven years of Marriott lodging. Of course I then get my card charged for my other reservations and had to have these fixed too. A few weeks later in December 2009 (before Christmas) Marriott contacts me saying there was a problem with my reservations for summer 2010 and they were researching the issue. Uhhh ok. I am then contacted by another Marriott employee soon after that and they tell me there was a “human error” with the rates of my reservations (why is that my problem?) and the Marriott employee changed my rates on my reservations to $300-400 per night. If I didn’t like the new rate which was now tripled I could cancel the reservations) and they would then give me a lousy $100 Marriott cheque (I had to cancel all of them to be eligible). I was told this a very equitable solution (tripling the cost of my reservations after months of planning is equitable?). Never mind that I am a silver elite member who had the reservations for almost six months and the rate was guaranteed. They went into the system sabotaging everyone of my confirmation #’. Bah humbug.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: superzuber
Reviews.Content: Writing this while in hotel. Arrived early (12:00) and the room was ready! Building is new and clean. Right on the Boardwalk, 15 blocks from the main activity. Inside pool with small "Conversation Pit" not a hot tub, but nice anyway. Staff nice, room nice, frig & microwave, wire & wireless internet. Balconies small, but nice to watch the ocean and boardwalk. Restaurant on site seems nice, but expensive, did not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: CCCLady
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at this hotel. I am a Marriott Reward member and I always try to choose Marriott. I was happy to see one opened in Ocean City. The hotel is brand new. We had a room with a side balcony but it had a wonderful view of the ocean. The room has a small refrig and microwave. The beds were comfortable. We had trouble with the wireless internet the first day but there was a wire for us to use in the room. We then had trouble with the wired connection on the second day and the wireless worked great. We requested late check out and we were extended to noon but when we got back from breakfast at 11AM our key would not work. The person at the front desk said all of the keys are programmed to stop working at 11AM if you are checking out that day. He did give us a new key and we went back to the room to gather our belongings. The hotel does not have free breakfast but there is a restaurant there but we did not use it. The pool area was very nice. I am so glad we choose the Courtyard to stay at. The rest of our family stayed at the Quality Inn next door. We spent some time over at their hotel on Saturday night but never went back after I saw a mouse in the room. My niece was told they have been trying to catch it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel & LOCATION - On the Beach!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, tasteful, comfortable & well appointed. It is located on the beach - but in a quiet area away from all the "tourist" shops & restaurants. Yet, it's accessable & close to all. You can walk every where. The room was VERY clean (I won't stay in anything less), spacious with the amenities we expect: TV, Coffee Maker, WiFi, fridge and microwave, etc. We had a room with a large jaccuzi. Great. THe best thing about this hotel is that it is on the beach. Great for taking walks along the boardwalk or just sitting on the beach. The front desk staff was ok. They didn't really offer much information. The cleaning staff was prompt & welcoming. Great lobby - you can sit and watch TV (several individual ones) or read the paper. Free coffee in the lobby. The restaurant is right off the lobby. We didn't eat there but went to the bar. Bartender was great! Made us feel very welcome. Parking in their garage is under the hotel. It's VERY tight. Very small spaces and very tight for pulling in and out. You'd better know how to drive. There is also a lot across the street for hotel guests. Beds were VERY comfortable. There is a pool & gym that we didn't use. I loved the fact that you cannot get to your room from the elevator on the garage level. You have to take it to the front desk. If you have a key to your room then you can use the 2nd elevator which is behind a locked door. Good security particularly since it's on the beach. I plan to stay here again. Wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1506
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a pleasant weekend at the Courtyard Marriott in Ocean City Maryland. This was my first trip to Ocean city and opted to stay at a chain hotel, due to my lack of confidence in motels. I couldn't have been happier. It is a great oceanfront hotel located on the boardwalk, close enough to everything. Yet far enough from the busy commotion. We had a room on the side and still had incredible ocean views, treat yourself to the oceanfront room, balconies looked quite amazing. The room decor was tastefully done with very comfortable beds. I have a 3 yr.old and a 11 yr. old so the fridge and microwave came in handy. We ate breakfast the first morning at the Captains table, the food and service were great. It was nice to have a restauarant on site. It also was a treat to have fresh coffee in the lobby every morning. The gym and pool were very clean. I was impressed with the design of the pool. It was an indoor pool with sliding doors that were open to the outside. The pool was not that big, but then again you are at the beach. It was perfect for this time of year and a late night swim. The weather was great so it felt like it was summer, this was the ideal place for a weekend getaway. We are Marriott Reward Members and once again very pleased with what Marriott has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Mellymel3918
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 12 year old daughter had the pleasure of an overnight stay (wish it could have been much,much longer) at the OC Courtyard on September 19th. We arrived and found a beautiful NEW (just opened in August 2009) beachfront hotel on the quiet end of the boardwalk away from the noise of the shops,restaurants, and amusements. I had opted for an early check-in as normal check-in is 4:00 pm. We got there around 12:30 pm and our room was not ready yet but that was ok since I know that requests for early check-in cannot be guaranteed. The male clerk at the reception desk was very gracious and friendly and gave us a key card so that we could access the changing room/swimming pool area and told us to check back around 2:00 pm as our room should be ready by then. We went out on the beach. It was a bit windy but otherwise it was a beautiful, sunny day. We checked back around 2:30 pm and our room was ready. We were very pleasantly surprised to be put in a beautiful oceanfront room on the 4th floor. This was a real treat as I had reserved a room with a balcony but did not opt for the oceanfront room as it was slightly more expensive and we were watching our money. I would definantely opt for the extra expense to reserve the ocean front room on our next stay as the view was spectacular. The room was so very clean,clean,clean. The furnishings were very tasteful including the beautiful bed coverings/sheets which were not standard hotel fare. The beds were very comfortable and I slept great. the bathroom was very clean and amenities great.The room was also very quiet. It was Delmarva Bike week and I could not even hear the thousands of motorcycles from the main drag. There was a choice of parking under the hotel which was limited but an overflow lot was offered right across the street. It was a great location as there were many restaurants nearby that you could walk to as well as a restaurant in the hotel. I also liked the extra security feature that the elevator located in the parking garage would only take you up to the lobby so you had only the choice to go to the reception desk using the elevator or stairs until you checked in. You had to have your room card key to access a door to access an elevator that would take you to all floors. The only minus that I could see was the very,very small pool but this was not an issue as we came to enjoy the beach. This would only be an issue if we were to visit in the cold months but we would more than likely only be going to OC when we could go on the beach for sun and fun. This was our first stay in a Marriott and it was by far the nicest place that we have ever stayed. An extra added nice touch was the fridge and microwave in the room and the free coffee that was served in the lobby in the AM. Also, hats off to all staff as everyone that we came into contact with was very friendly and helpful. We will definantely be back as I am very,very picky about cleanliness where we stay and this was wonderful. The only small problem that I had is that the room card keys are a little stubborn and had to make several attempts before I could get the door open. Also, your card key will not work for you to re-enter the room after the 11:00 am check out time so make sure that you are checked out by 11:00 am or a very helpful maid(such as we had) will need to let you back in your room.Keep up the great work,clean rooms, and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Best night sleep in years!”
Reviews.Author: reeselizabeth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. On 16th street on the boardwalk. Friendly service, great amenities. They allowed us to check in early and check out late. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. I have a very hard time sleeping but the night I stayed here I had the best sleep I've had in years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Giz1595
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Courtyard. This hotel is a great addition to the boardwalk. We arrived in OC on a Thursday night with no particular hotel in mine. We were driving along when we noticed the Courtyard and went back. The desk clerk was very friendly and helpful. The room was on the 4th floor with a side view of the ocean. On Friday morning we ate breakfast at the in hotel restaurant. The staff were very attentive and the good was very good. We would definately stay here on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to say what a disappointment it was...”
Reviews.Author: DrRickG
Reviews.Content: Before I get into the details of this review, I must preface this by saying that I am a long-time Marriott Rewards member and a big fan of Marriott. I am also not one to complain about every little thing and in general am quite easy to please. So it is with some regret that I have to say that we were not happy with the Marriott Courtyard in Ocean City, MD. In fact, we were quite disappointed. The weather forecast looked great and we were looking for a last-minute, middle-of-the-week getaway "down the ocean". Our only two requirements for a place to stay were that it had to be oceanfront and the place had to have an outdoor pool (with two young children, we knew that although they would enjoy spending time on the beach, ocean swimming would not be practical, especially in the wake of Hurricane Bill). Being a last-minute trip, the options were limited. My first preference was to stay at the Hilton, but they were all booked-up. So being a big fan of Marriott, and wishing to earn some more Rewards points, I thought that a two-night stay at their brand new beachfront property would be just what we were looking for. Besides, they were on the beach and had an outdoor pool, right? So we were very disappointed when we checked in to find out that their "outdoor" pool was really a very, very small pool housed in a greenhouse type enclosure without any direct sunlight (I guess with the windows opened it kind of qualifies as an outdoor pool). To call it an outdoor pool is very misleading. To make matters worse, there was a problem with their pool, rendering it unusable. The front desk apologized and said that the pool should be filled-up and ready to use by evening. So even though the kids were disappointed, we went up to our room to change for the beach. The room was very nice: clean, well-appointed, with a perfect view of the boardwalk and ocean. We enjoyed several hours on the beach, but once evening came and the pool was still empty, we knew the chances of it being ready during our stay were quite low. Anyway, we had a fun night on the boardwalk and were ready to crash back in our hotel room. Our lights were out by 11 pm, but the noise of loud voices and the constant slamming of doors made it one of the most unpleasant and sleepless nights I have ever spent in a hotel. I don't think that the people on our floor were being particularly loud, but the doors and walls seemed so thin and the large gap at the bottom of the door let in a lot of light and noise from the hallway. In addition, every door on our hallway slammed shut. I was lucky if I got two hours sleep the entire night. The next morning I went down for coffee and saw that the pool was still not available. Right then and there, after a terrible night, I pulled out my Blackberry and was able to get a room which opened-up last-minute at the Hilton. I went up to the front desk to tell them that we would not be staying an additional night. I really wasn't going to even get into it (besides, as I said, I'm not really one to complain), but when asked how our stay was, I had to express my displeasure with the pool and the terrible amount of noise. The manager overheard and immediately came over to see what was the matter. He did say that they were having some trouble with some of the doors on some rooms not being hung properly, which may have contributed to the noise coming into our room. I also told him that there was no door sweep at the bottom of the door, so there was no blocking of any noise or light coming in from the hallway. It looked to me that this was an old condo building that was renovated by Marriott, so maybe the original construction wasn't high quality. In any event, I didn't want to spend another $350 to not be able to use the pool and to be kept awake all night, so we decided to check out and go to the Hilton. The manager was very polite and said that he was sorry, and even offered a $175 credit on our one night stay. This was appreciated, and we used the $$ to defray the cost of our bar tab at the swim-up bar at the Hilton :) Anyway, I don't think I'd stay at the Courtyard again, especially since the Hilton is about the same price and was way more like a resort (unlike our time at the Courtyard, we had a BLAST at the Hilton!! The kids are still talking about it). I don't know if our experience was an isolated instance, but I can't say that I'd recommend this property until they get some of the kinks worked out with the door-slamming and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Edition to the Boardwalk Hotels”
Reviews.Author: YoungBuckTravel
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Ocean City ever since I can remember and have a lot of memories there. Most of the hotels here are good but aren't really great or stand out. I went down to Ocean City on a whim for a weekend getaway and to propose to my now fiance. We didn't have reservations but being near the end of summer we thought that there should definately be some rooms open. We were diappointed to find that none of the hotels had vacancy. We then came across the Courtyard Mariott and saw they had a sign with vacancy. We decided to stop, not knowing it was a brand new hotel and see if they had a room available. We got the last room left and were sort of keeping our fingers crossed that it would be nice. What a pleasant surprise. The rooms were great, the beds were magnificant, and the hotel was in a great location on the boardwalk. This hotel is definately much better than your average Ocean City Hotel. Although we could only stay for the weekend, we enjoyed this hotel so much so that any future stays in OC we will definately check out the mariott first. The price was great considering that it was still in the High Season and for a Boardwalk hotel. We had a room to the side of the hotel but still had a view of the ocean and boardwalk. Definately a great addition the rest of the boardwalk hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: MsMJB
Reviews.Content: The good thing is, this place is practically NEW!!!! Everything is clean, service top notch. If you reserve online it's a minimum 2 night (?) stay (as with majority of the hotels in Ocean City). My boyfriend and I couldn't do a full weekend, but we took a chance and drove to OC with no reservations. We stopped at a couple of places (major hotel chains) only to find out they were booked. We stopped at the Courtyard and wow there was room at the "inn" :) In not being picky, because we knew that weekend was packed with visitors, we decided to go with whatever was available. Bingo! Our room was a double (2 queen beds) with an Ocean Front View. Every room has a mini fridge and microwave, wireless internet service (free) and just a lil perk for us music lovers - the alarm clock is also an Ipod deck to charge and listen to your music!! The hotel is somewhat in the middle of attractions along the boardwalk. If you walk up, a few places to shop and eat, and eventuallly the starting point of the boardwalk trolley. If you walk down the boardwalk you are heading towards the amusements and a more variety of shops and places to eat. The Courtyard was the perfect spot for our mini getaway. The outside says Miami-like and once inside your room...It's the perfect comfort zone. I plan to make the Courtyard my hotel anytime I stay in Ocean City, MD. The only minor pain.. is.. the lobby/pool/resturant/ is on the 3rd floor, so the entrance is kind of wierd when you check in. But that's minor....Soooo minor.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel - Nice but not compared to others”
Reviews.Author: chelle695
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed at the brand new Marriott Courtyard in Ocean City. I was really excited because there are a lot of rundown hotels in Ocean city and since this is a new hotel I figured it would be a nice change of pace. All and all a very nice hotel but if compared to the Hilton Suites or Holiday Inn Suites just two blocks away it does not compare for the price. You can get a suite there for almost the same price that has a separate bedroom, full kitchen, living area, dining area, jacuzzi tub, two heated pools and more so if you are weighing options they are a much better deal. I had just a regular hotel room, it was a nice size hotel room which was crisp and clean which was nice. Air conditioning was phenominal! Positives: - Fresh and new, very clean - To use the guest elevators you must have a room key which made me feel nice and secure. - Large hotel room. Mini Fridge and microwave. - Great Air conditioning - Nice, new flat screen tv - Excellent beds Negatives: - Parking under the building was HORRIBLE! Very tiny spots and very congested. - Layout is a little strange. - Small pool

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Ocean City
HotelInfo.Address: Two 15th Street, Ocean City, MD 21842
